translation:
adj. 彻底的，全面的，充分的，彻头彻尾的，根本的，详尽的，严密的; 十足的，考虑周到的; 非常精确的，（对细节）不厌其烦的; 绝对的，完善的
prep. 〈古〉同“through”
n. [英史]专横政策

分布：彻底的(72%)，完全的(18%)，详尽的(9%)，细致深入的(1%)


→来自 through 拼写变体或表强调，引申词义彻底的，完全的等。
a.彻底的,完全的;精心的Although the plan was thorough, it was not carried through.尽管计划很周详,但是没有得到贯彻.



US ['θɝ:-/ UK [-oʊ] adjective CAREFUL  仔细的   ADVANCED  ■detailed and careful 仔细的
•a thorough revision of the manuscript对手稿的仔细修改

•They did a thorough search of the area but found nothing.他们仔细搜索了该地区，但一无所获。

UK ['θʌr.ə] US ['θɝ:-/ UK [-oʊ] adjective COMPLETE  完全的  ■complete, very great, very much 彻头彻尾的；完全的；十足的
•It was a thorough waste of time.这完全是浪费时间。




adj. 彻底的；十分的；周密的
 - complete, radical
examples: 英 ['θʌrə] 美 ['θɜːroʊ]
adj.彻底的；完全的；详尽的；细致深入的

(1) I gave the radio a thorough inspection before buying it.(2) We are trying to get a thorough understanding of the government's fiscal policy.(3) She underwent a thorough examination at the hospital.(4) We gave our room a thorough cleaning the next day.(5) He doesn't have a thorough grasp of the problem.(6) That has been a thorough waste of time.(7) The film was a thorough success.(8) He made a thorough investigation of the case.(9) I like a dyed-in-the-wool killer. Cold-blooded, clean, methodical and thorough.(10) His thorough knowledge and competence were recognized.(11) When my boss takes a long time, he is thorough.(12) She had a more thorough conviction of his talents.(13) She is not brilliant, but she is thorough.

(1) 我把收音机彻底检查了一遍才买了下来。(2) 我们正努力对政府的财政政策进行全面的了解。(3) 她在医院里接受了全面检查。(4) 第二天,我们彻底地打扫了房间。(5) 他没有彻底理解这个问题。(6) 这是十足的浪费时间。(7) 这电影获得极大的成功。(8) 这件事他作了详尽的调查。(9) 我喜欢纯粹的杀手。冷血,干净,办事有条理,彻底细致。(10) 他的渊博的学识和工作能力得到了承认。(11) 老板做事情花了长时间,是深思熟虑。(12) 她对他的才能有了更深入的体会。(13) 她并非才华横溢，但很仔细。

translation:
n. 思想; 想法; 关心; 思索
v. 想( think的过去式和过去分词); 思索; 以为; 认为

分布：思想(55%)，想法(31%)，关心(5%)，打算(3%)，观念(2%)，顾虑(2%)，意向(1%)，思念(1%)


→来自 think 的名词形式，-th,名词后缀，在 h 后缩写为 t.
n.思想,思考,思维;意图,打算;想法Have you any thoughts about our next holiday?下个假日怎么度过,你有什么想法吗?



US [θɑ:t] verb past simple and past participle of■think 
UK [θɔ:t] US [θɑ:t] noun countable or uncountable  ESSENTIAL  ■the act of thinking about or considering something, an idea or opinion, or a set of ideas about a particular subject 思考；考虑；思想
•Ask me again tomorrow. I'll have to give it some thought.明天再问我吧，我还得考虑一下。

•She doesn't give any thought to her appearance.她根本不注意自己的仪表。

•Let me have your thoughts on that report by Friday.星期五之前告诉我你对那份报告的看法吧。

•Spare a  thought  for (= Think about) all those without shelter on a cold night like this.想想那些在这样的寒夜无处栖身的人们。

•He's the author of a book on the history of European thought.他写过一本有关欧洲思想史的书。

•You sent her a card? That was a kind thought.你给她送了贺卡？你想得很周到。

UK [θɔ:t] US [θɑ:t] noun countable or uncountable that's a thought ■that's a good idea 那是个好主意
•"Shall we go on Thursday instead of Friday?" "That's a thought."“我们把星期五去改成星期四去好吗？”“好主意。”

UK [θɔ:t] US [θɑ:t] noun countable or uncountable the thought crosses sb's mind ■If the thought of (doing) something crosses someone's mind, they think about it for a short time （某人的）头脑中闪过…念头
•The thought had crossed my mind that I might need some help with the project.我脑中曾闪过这样的念头——项目上我可能需要帮助。

UK [θɔ:t] US [θɑ:t] noun countable or uncountable with no thought for sth ■not thinking about a particular thing 对…不考虑
•With no thought for his own safety, he rushed towards the burning car.他不顾个人安危，冲向着火的汽车。





conception, concept, idea, notion, impression, thought

这组词都有“思想、观点、观念”的意思，其区别是：
conception: 通常指个人或一些人所持有的具体概念或念头，也可指概念的形成过程，含一定的想象和感情色彩意味。
concept: 指从众多实例中通过概括、归纳而形成的对事物本质、全貌及其内部联系的概念或看法。
idea: 最普通常用词，几乎适用于任何方面的思维活动。
notion: 指的是一种模糊的，变化的莫测的想法，无可靠的基础，未经深思熟虑的观点。
impression: 指外部刺激在思想中所产生的印象。
thought: 指以推理、思考等智力活动为基础的心理思维活动及其结果。


n. 思想；思考；想法；关心
 - idea, concepts, attention, consideration
v. 想，思考；认为（think的过去式和过去分词）
 - reflected, deemed
examples: 英 [θɔːt] 美 [θɔːt]
n.思想；想法；意向；思念；观念；打算；关心；顾虑v.想，思考，考虑（动词think的过去式和过去分词）

(1) The old man was lost in thought and did not hear us come in.(2) Art is the mold of feeling as language is the mold of thought.(3) They stood possessed by the same thought.(4) The thought nerved me to make an other effort.(5) She lingered on the thought of her loved ones.(6) Let my thought comes to you. When I am gone, like the afterglow of sunset at the margin of starry silence.(7) Learn new culture, create new thought, establish new idea and reach new success.(8) Take no thought for your future needs.(9) It's the thought that counts.(10) Don't give it atonher thought.

(1) 这个老人凝神沉思，没有听见我们进来。(2) 艺术是感情的模制品,犹如语言是思想的模制品。(3) 他们站在那儿,心里让同样的想法所盘踞。(4) 这种想法激励我再作一番努力。(5) 她缠绵地思念着心爱的人儿。(6) 在我离别后,让我的思念映照着你,宛如夕阳的余辉环绕着星辰冷寂的边缘。(7) 学新文化,创新思想,立新观念,铸就新佳进!(8) 不必为将来的需要而操心。(9) 有这份心意就好了。(10) 不要再想了.

translation:
adj. 沉思的; 体贴的; 缜密思考过的，深思熟虑的

分布：体贴的(64%)，深思的(36%)


→thought,思想，-ful,形容词后缀。引申词义思考的，体贴的等。
a.认真思考的,沉思的;体贴的,关心的He remained thoughtful for a while.他深思了一会儿.



US ['θɑ:t-] adjective  ADVANCED  ■carefully considering things 考虑周到的；计划周密的
•He has a thoughtful approach to his work.他工作很细心周到。
 ADVANCED  ■quiet because you are thinking about something 沉思的
•You look thoughtful.你看起来心里有事。
 ADVANCED  ■kind and always thinking about how you can help other people 体贴的，关心的
•Thank you for phoning when I was ill - it was very thoughtful of you.我生病时谢谢你打电话来问候——你真是体贴人。

•She's a very thoughtful person.她是一个很体贴的人。
 Opposite thoughtless




considerate, thoughtful, attentive

这些形容词均含“关心的，体贴的”之意。
considerate: 指能设身处地为别人着想，给予同情或谅解。
thoughtful: 指为他人着想，主动关怀，做有益于他人的事。
attentive: 指对人关怀备至，热情周到，这可能出于真诚，也可能出于私利。


adj. 深思的；体贴的；关切的
 - considerate
examples: 英 ['θɔːtfl] 美 ['θɔːtfl]
adj.深思的；体贴的

(1) He had a thoughtful look on his face.(2) The young girl in the picture has a thoughtful and solemn mien.(3) It's most thoughtful of you.(4) A thoughtful present is always appreciated.(5) They are very obliging and thoughtful.
(1) 他脸上露出深思的表情。(2) 画中的年轻女孩带着一副沉思而又严肃的神态。(3) 您想得真周到。(4) 一个体贴的礼物总会令人感激。(5) 他们可真殷勤，真会体贴人。
[sound:youdao-7fb309cb-c3b9d1de-76e6bd45-b73b5233-fb68b540.mp3]

translation:
n. 一千; 数千; 许许多多; 千位数
adj. 一千的; 一千个的; 成千的; 许许多多的

分布：许许多多(100%)


→来自古英语thusend,千，来自Proto-Germanic*thusundi,千，词首*thu 可能来自teue,膨胀， 鼓起，词源同thigh,thumb,-sundi,来自Proto-Germanic*hundam,百，词源同hundred.该词字面 意思为好几百，后在翻译拉丁语mille(千，词源同million）的过程中逐渐确定为固定数词。
num./n./a.一千;[pl.]许许多多,成千上万The grand commander demands thousands of sandy sandwiches.大司令官要成千个沙色三明治.



['θaʊ.zənd] (plural thousand or thousands)number  ESSENTIAL  ■the number 1000 （数字）1000a thousand/thousands of sth informal ■a large number 一个大的数字
•I've got a thousand things to do before we go on holiday.我们去渡假前，我还有很多事情要做。
the thousands ■numbers between 1000 and 1 000 000 成千上万（介乎1,000和1,000,000之间的数字）
•His latest work is expected to sell in the thousands.他的最新作品预计可卖出上千上万册。

['θaʊ.zənd] (plural thousand or thousands)number   Common Learner Errors   thousands (of sth) or thousand?When thousand  is used after a particular number, it is used in the singular form and without 'of'.Don't say 'five/ten/fifteen thousands of sth', say five/ten/fifteen  thousand sth:✗ The stadium can hold fifty thousands of fans.The stadium can hold fifty thousand fans.When thousand  is used without a particular number, it is used in the plural form and is sometimes followed by 'of':The stadium can hold thousands (of fans).



n. [数] 一千；一千个；许许多多
 - hundreds of, lots and lots
adj. 成千的；无数的
 - million, countless, infinite
examples: 英 ['θaʊznd] 美 ['θaʊznd]
n.千n.【C】成千上万；许许多多
(1) Thousands of spectators watched the sailing.(2) I am a thousand winds that blow.
(1) 数千名观众观看了这次游艇比赛。(2) 我是扬起千千遍遍的风.
[sound:youdao-20b0d602-b37d5e6f-c647ba00-160e822d-9766b66d.mp3]

translation:
n. 线; 线索; 线状物; 螺纹
vt. 穿成串; 将（针、线等）穿过…; 用…线缝; 给…装入（胶片、狭带、绳子）

时态：threaded, threading, threads
分布：线(80%)，螺纹(9%)，穿过(5%)，线索(3%)，思路(1%)，细丝(1%)，穿线于(1%)


→来自古英语 thraed,线，绳索，来自 Proto-Germanic*threduz,纺线，编线，来自 tere,弯， 转，编织，词源同 turn,throw.引申词义线索，脉络等。
n.线,细丝;线索,思路;螺纹v.穿线,穿过The reader already readily spread the thread on the ready-made bread.那位读者已经欣然将丝线铺散在现成的面包上.



noun FIBRE  纤维  countable or uncountable ■(a length of) a very thin fibre 线
•needle and thread针线

•loose threads松的线
countable ■a long thin line of something such as light or smoke （光、烟等）线状物，线状体
•A thin thread of light made its way through the curtains.一缕光线透过帘子射进来。

[θred] noun CONNECTION  关连  countable ■The thread of a book, discussion, speech, etc. is its story or the way that it develops, one part connecting with another 思路；贯穿的主线
•One of the main threads of the film is the development of the relationship between the boy and his uncle.电影的其中一条主线是男孩和他叔叔之间的关系发展。

•Unfortunately my attention wandered for a moment and I lost the thread of (= forgot) what I was saying.遗憾的是我一时失神，忘了刚才在说甚么。
countable ■a connected group of pieces of writing on the Internet, where people are talking about a particular subject 帖子（网际网路上一组相关的文章，全都围绕人们谈论的一个特定主题）
•I was so pleased to find this thread, and to know that lots of people have the same problem as me!我很高兴看到这个帖子，发现很多人和我一样都有这个问题！

[θred] noun SCREW  螺钉  countable ■a continuous raised line, such as the one which goes around the outside of a screw or bolt or the inside of a hole 螺纹
[θred] verb transitive ■to put something long and thin such as string or thread through a narrow hole or into a small space 穿线于；使穿过
•to thread a needle穿针

•The sari had gold strands threaded through the material.这件莎丽的布料间穿上了金线。

[θred] verb transitive thread your way through/between, etc. ■to move carefully through a crowded space, changing direction in order to avoid people or things （避开障碍）穿过，通过（拥挤地带）
•She threaded her way through the crowded market place.她穿过人群拥挤的市场。





rope, wire, thread, string, line, cord

这组词都有“线”的意思，其区别是：
rope: 指用于捆绑大物件的粗壮而坚固的绳子，一般用绵、毛、麻、金属或其它材料制成。
wire: 专指用金属制成的线。
thread: 普通用词，指用棉、毛、丝或纤维等纹成的很细的线，通常用于缝纫、纺织等。
string: 普通用词，指捆绑小件物品的细绳或细带子。
line: 普通用词，含义广泛，指任何一种线，常作引申用。
cord: 指比string粗，比rope细，较牢固，通常用于捆扎较小物品的线或绳。用作引申当约束讲。


n. [纺] 线； [机] 螺纹；思路；衣服；线状物；玻璃纤维；路线
 - string, clothes, array, line, route
vt. 穿过；穿线于；使交织
 - move through, go across
vi. 通过；穿透过
 - get through sth, get across
examples: 英 [θred] 美 [θred]
n.线；思路；螺纹；线索；细丝；帖子vt.穿过；穿线于；遍布vi.滴下成丝状；小心地通过；蜿蜒前进

(1) How many spools of thread did you use?(2) The thread seems to match the cloth.(3) I need one more spool of thread before finishing the embroidery.(4) He passed me a coil of thread.(5) The girl tied the ends of the thread.(6) The little girl threaded the shells together and wore them round her neck.(7) I'm afraid I've lost the thread of your argument.
(1) 你用了几轴线?(2) 这线和这布似乎很相称。(3) 再来一轴线我就可以完成这幅刺绣了。(4) 他递给我一卷线。(5) 这女孩把线的两端结起来。(6) 小女孩把贝壳穿成一串，戴在脖子上。(7) 我恐怕没有抓住你的论据的思路。
[sound:youdao-d47f3374-6fea3d72-34d43f1d-2b9ff3b6-ee3d4858.mp3]

translation:
n. 威胁; 恐吓; 凶兆

分布：威胁(93%)，恐吓(4%)，凶兆(3%)


→来自古英语 threat,胁迫，威胁，来自 Proto-Germanic*thrautam,压迫，促使，来自 treud, 推，紧压，词源同 thrust,extrude,obtrude.
n.恐吓,威胁;坏兆头,危险迹象He took not notice of his father's threat.他不理会他父亲的恐吓.



noun countable  ESSENTIAL  ■a suggestion that something unpleasant or violent will happen, especially if a particular action or order is not followed 威胁，恐吓
•[+ to infinitive] She carried out her threat to throw away any clothes that were left on the floor.她将她的威胁付诸行动，把丢在地上的衣服全都扔掉了。

•The threat of jail failed to deter him from petty crime.坐牢没能吓住他搞小偷小摸。

•Drunken drivers pose a serious threat (= cause a lot of harm) to other road users.酒后驾车者对其他路人构成了严重威胁。

•He says he'll tell the authorities but it's just an empty threat (= it will not happen).他称他要向当局报告，不过那只是一句吓唬人的话。
be under threat of sth ■to be in a situation where people are threatening you with something bad or unpleasant 受到…的威胁
•She left the country under threat of arrest if she returned.她离开了那个国家，并被警告，一旦返回就会被逮捕。





risk, danger, threat, menace, hazard, peril

这组词都有“危险、威胁”的意思，其区别是：
risk: 指有可能发生的危险，尤指主动进行某种活动或去碰运气而冒的危险。
danger: 含义广，普通用词，指能够造成伤害、损害或不利的任何情况。
threat: 普通用词，语气弱于menace，指任何公开侵犯对方的言行，给对方构成危险或威胁。
menace: 所指的危险性最严重，表示使用暴力或造成破坏性的可能。
hazard: 比risk正式，多指偶然发生的或无法控制的危险，常含较严重或有一定风险的意味。
peril: 指迫在眉睫很有可能发生的严重危险。


n. 威胁，恐吓；凶兆
 - danger, intimidation
examples: [联想] 数到三就吃了你，赤裸裸的威胁。
英 [θret] 美 [θret]
n.威胁；恐吓；凶兆

(1) His presence is a threat to our success.(2) The threat of an economic depression hangs over the world.(3) Pollution poses a threat to the continued existence of this species.(4) He took not notice of his father's threat.(5) There was a threat of typhoon.
(1) 他的出现对我们的成功是一个威胁。(2) 经济衰退的威胁笼罩着世界。(3) 污染对这一物种的继续生存造成了威胁。(4) 他不理会他父亲的恐吓。(5) 有刮台风的征兆。
[sound:youdao-a5bc92bc-30911054-57414f2e-ffcebf32-c18cedbb.mp3]

translation:
vt. & vi. 预示（某事）; 恐吓; 危及; 预示凶兆
vi. 似将发生; 威胁

时态：threatened, threatening, threatens
分布：威胁(90%)，恐吓(8%)，似将发生(2%)


→threat,威胁，-en,使。
v.恐吓,威胁;有...危险,快要来临In the theater I threatened to treat the treaty with retreat.在剧院里,我威胁要以退却来对待条约.



verb  ESSENTIAL  transitive ■to tell someone that you will kill or hurt them, or cause problems for them if they do not do what you want 威胁，恐吓；扬言要
•They threatened the shopkeeper with a gun.他们用枪威胁店主。

•[+ to infinitive] They threatened to kill him unless he did as they asked.他们威胁要杀他，除非他按他们说的去做。
transitive ■to be likely to cause harm or damage to something or someone 威胁到；危害到
•Changing patterns of agriculture are threatening the countryside.农业模式的不断变化可能会对农村造成破坏。
intransitive ■If something bad threatens to happen, it is likely to happen 预示凶兆；逼近
•Look at those clouds! There's a storm threatening.看那些云！暴风雨要来了。





menace, threaten

这组词都有“威胁、恐吓”的意思，其区别是：
menace: 系正式用词，着重以脸色或某种意志给以威胁，而不用语言明白表示出来。
threaten: 侧重扬言要对不服从者给予惩罚，有时指某种情况所预示的恶兆。


vt. 威胁；恐吓；预示
 - indicate, forecast, shadow, cow
vi. 威胁；可能来临
 - to menace, hang over
examples: 英 ['θretn] 美 ['θretn]
v.威胁；恐吓；似将发生

(1) The rebels threatened to seize civilian hostages.(2) The strikers were threatened with dismissal if they did not return to work.(3) The black clouds threatened rain.(4) If a gale threatens, do not go to sea.
(1) 叛乱分子威胁要扣押平民为人质。(2) 罢工者受到威胁说，如果他们不复工，就会被解雇。(3) 乌云密布预示着将要下雨。(4) 假若要起风
[sound:youdao-111eca02-64907c3d-fd2ed197-f4891ad2-1ecedc56.mp3]

translation:
vt. 使激动; 使陶醉; 使颤动、战栗或振动
vi. 由于兴奋或激动而感到一种突然的颤动; 颤动、战栗或振动
n. [病]震颤; 震颤感; 兴奋感

时态：thrilled, thrilling, thrills
分布：激动(82%)，感到紧张(13%)，引起激动的事物(5%)


→来自古英语 thyrlian,钻孔，打洞，穿过，来自 thyrel,洞，来自 thurh,穿过，通过，即 through 的古英语拼写形式。引申诸相关词义。
n.一阵激动(恐惧)v.激动;(使)毛骨悚然I thrilled to see him win the first prize.我看到他获得首奖感到很兴奋.



noun countable ■a feeling of extreme excitement, usually caused by something pleasant 兴奋；激动；紧张感
•the thrill of winning a competition赢得比赛的激动

•So why do people still go hunting - is it the thrill of the chase?那么为甚么人们还去打猎——是不是因为追捕猎物让人感到兴奋刺激?

•It gave me a real thrill to see her again after so many years.这么多年以后与她重逢，着实令我激动。

•The video shows the thrills and spills (= excitement and accidents) of motor racing.录像呈现了紧张刺激的赛车场面。

[θrɪl] verb intransitive or transitive ■to make someone feel very excited and pleased 兴奋；激动；紧张感
•Ballesteros thrilled the golf world with his performance.巴列斯特罗斯以精湛的球技震动了高尔夫球界。




n. 激动； [医] 震颤；紧张
 - intensity, stress, tension, warmth, excitation
vt. 使…颤动；使…紧张；使…感到兴奋或激动
 - tie oneself up in knots
vi. 颤抖；感到兴奋；感到紧张
 - quake, judder
examples: 英 [θrɪl] 美 [θrɪl]
n.激动；引起激动的事物；震颤（医学）v.(使)激动；感到紧张

(1) It gave me a real thrill to see her again after so many years.(2) With a thrill I realized that I had won.(3) It was a rael thrill to meet the Queen.(4) Hester looked at him with a thrill of another joy.(5) Early pericarditis may also produce a friction thrill.(6) It's a sight that never fails to thrill me.(7) We're immensely thrilled to learn of your success.(8) She thrilled at the shrill clang of the ambulance bell.
(1) 那么多年后与她重逢,我非常激动。(2) 我意识到自己获得了胜利(3) 能见到女王的确是令人兴奋的事。(4) 海丝特望着他，心头又是一阵喜悦的震颤。(5) 早期心包炎也会产生一种摩擦性震颤。(6) 那是一种永远让我激动不已的景象。(7) 听说你获得了成功,我们真是兴奋极了。(8) 她听到救护车刺耳的当当声总是感到紧张。
[sound:youdao-abe2051c-3a436ffd-3c4e4789-b92ba017-0a8d747d.mp3]

translation:
vi. 兴盛，兴隆; 长得健壮; 茁壮成长

时态：thrived, thriving, thrives
分布：繁荣(42%)，兴旺(31%)，茁壮成长(27%)


→来自中古英语 thriven,繁荣，兴旺，来自 Proto-Germanic*thribana,抓住，使繁盛，来自 trep, 使满意，使享受，词源同 Terpsichore,古希腊神话中的歌舞女神，字面意思为享受舞蹈者。
v.兴旺,繁荣From the fact, the shivering driver derives that the diver may thrive on river.发抖的司机从这个事实得出结论说跳水员可以靠河流繁荣.
【区】thrift（n 节俭；节约）【反】languish（v 憔悴；凋萎）；wizen（v 枯萎；消瘦）；fail（v 失败）



[θraɪv] (thrived or US ALSO throve, thrived or US ALSO thriven)verb intransitive ■to grow, develop or be successful 茁壮成长；兴旺，繁荣
•His business thrived in the years before the war.战前那些年，他的生意很兴隆。

•She seems to thrive on stress.她似乎很擅长在压力下工作。





succeed, prosper, thrive, flourish

这组词都有“兴旺，成功”的意思，其区别是：
succeed: 表示成功，强调完成某件想往或企图去做的事，与fail相对。
prosper: 指持续不断地成功，也指越来越成功。
thrive: 指蓬勃发展，常指显而易见的成功。
flourish: 指处于成功、繁荣、进步的顶盛阶段。


vi. 繁荣，兴旺；茁壮成长
 - succeed, flower
examples: 英 [θraɪv] 美 [θraɪv]
vi.兴旺；繁荣；茁壮成长

(1) A business cannot thrive without good management.(2) But will they survive and thrive?(3) May our country prosper and thrive forever!(4) A business can not thrive without investment.(5) Few plants or animals thrive in the desert.(6) Sheep do not thrive on long pasture.(7) Children thrive on fresh air and good food.
(1) 没有良好的经营管理，事业就不会兴旺发达。(2) 但是，他们会生存下来并兴旺繁殖吗?(3) 希望我们的国家繁荣兴旺，长盛不衰。(4) 没有投资任何生意都无法繁荣。(5) 很少植物或动物能在沙漠中很好地生长。(6) 羊吃长草不能健壮。(7) 儿童的健康成长需要有新鲜的空气和富有营养的食物。
[sound:youdao-1b63c552-df011c41-2a50684f-b10e4e91-c6aade06.mp3]

translation:
n. 咽喉; 颈前部; [植物学]管颈
vt. 用沙哑的声音或嗓音发音

分布：喉咙(65%)，嗓子(30%)，颈部(2%)，嗓音(2%)，低语(1%)


→来自古英语 throte,喉咙，来自 Proto-Germanic*thrut,喉咙，来自 trud,膨胀，鼓起，词源 同 throttle.
n.咽喉,嗓子When the boat floats through the throat, the goat in overcoat goes to the goal.当船漂过狭口时,穿大衣的山羊朝目标走去.



US [θroʊt] noun countable  IMPROVER  ■the front of the neck, or the space inside the neck down which food and air can go 颈前部；咽喉，喉咙
•A fish bone got stuck in my throat.我喉咙里鲠了一根鱼刺。

•a sore throat咽喉痛

•He cleared his throat (= coughed so he could speak more clearly) and started speaking.他清了清嗓子，然后开始讲话。

UK [θrəʊt] US [θroʊt] noun countable at each other's throats ■If two people are at each other's throats, they are arguing angrily （两人）激烈争吵
•Those two are always at each other's throats.那两人总是吵个没完。

UK [θrəʊt] US [θroʊt] noun countable force/ram sth down sb's throat ■to force someone to listen to opinions and ideas and to try to get them to accept them 强迫（某人）接受
•I can't bear it when someone starts ramming their views down your throat.我受不了别人把自己的观点强加于人。




n. 喉咙；嗓子，嗓音；窄路
 - organ, voice
examples: 英 [θrəʊt] 美 [θroʊt]
n.嗓子；喉咙；颈部；嗓音vt.低语；压着嗓子说(唱)

(1) I have a sore throat today.(2) I have to clear my throat before I begin my speech.(3) I've got a fish bone stuck in my throat.(4) He grabbed his enemy by the throat.(5) She sang at the top of her throat.
(1) 我今天嗓子疼。(2) 在开始演讲之前,我得先清清嗓子。(3) 有根鱼骨头卡在我的喉咙里。(4) 他掐住敌人的颈部。(5) 她放开嗓门大声歌唱。

translation:
n. 宝座; 御座; 王位; 王权
vi. 登上王座
vt. 使即王位，使登基

时态：throned, throning, thrones
分布：王位(92%)，君主(8%)


→来自希腊语 thronos,座位，王座，来自 dher,固定，稳固，词源同 firm,tree,endure.比喻用 法。
n.御座,宝座;王位,王权Once none of you is here, the man in throne will live alone in the lonely zone.一旦你们没有人在此,王位上的人就要孤独地生活在这个孤寂的地带.



US [θroʊn] noun countable  ADVANCED  ■the special chair used by a ruler, especially a king or queen 王座；王位the throne  ADVANCED  ■the state of being a ruler 王位；王权；君权
•Elizabeth II ascended/came to the throne (= became queen of Britain) when her father died.伊丽莎白二世在她父亲逝世后登上王位。

•Queen Victoria was on the throne (= was queen) at that time.那时维多利亚女王在位。

•Charles is next in line to the throne (= will become king next).查理斯将继承王位。




n. 王座；君主；王权
 - emperor, crown, sovereignty
examples: 英 [θrəʊn] 美 [θroʊn]
n.王位；君主
(1) Henry IV usurped the throne of England.(2) He set up a claim to the throne.(3) He was only eight when he ascended the throne.(4) He swore allegiance to the throne.
(1) 亨利四世篡夺了英国的王位。(2) 他自称王位是属于他的。(3) 他登上王位时才八岁。(4) 他宣誓效忠国王。

translation:
n. 人群，大群人; 众多
vt. & vi. 群集; 蜂拥而至; 挤满

时态：thronged, thronging, throngs
分布：人群(48%)，一大群(16%)，群集(15%)，挤满(14%)，大量(7%)


→来自中英语 thrang,人群，来自 Proto-Germanic*thrangwa,人群，来自 trenk,挤，压，催促， 可能来自 tere,弯，转，扭曲，词源同 turn,throw,torque.比喻用法，即拧在一起。
【记】th死，rong冗：死人冗余了－群集【区】throne（n 王座；君主）



US [θrɑ:ŋ] noun countable [+ sing/pl verb] ■a crowd or large group of people 人群；群众
•A huge throng had gathered round the speaker.讲者周围聚集了一大群人。

UK [θrɒŋ] US [θrɑ:ŋ] verb intransitive + adverb or preposition transitive ■to be or go somewhere in very large numbers （人群）蜂拥，群集
•Crowds thronged the market place.市场里挤满了人。

•The narrow streets were thronged with summer visitors.狭窄的街道上挤满了夏天来此的游客。

•[+ to infinitive] Thousands of people thronged to see the exhibition while it was in London.展览在伦敦举办时，成千上万的人蜂拥而至。





people, masses, crowd, throng, mob

这些名词均有“人们，人群”之意。
people: 最普通用词，不带任何色彩，泛指不确定数量的人们。
masses: 指群众或平民，在西方国家含贬义，在我国含褒义。
crowd: 本义指一大群紧紧聚集在一起的人群，现指群众整体，由个体结合的人群或大众。
through: 与crowd含义很接近，常可换用，但侧重指向前运动的群众。
mob: 含贬义，指乌合之众、暴民。


n. 人群；众多
 - crowd, mass
vt. 群集；挤满
 - burst at the seams, be packed with
vi. 蜂拥而至；群集
 - host, pack
adj. 拥挤的
 - crowded, jammed
examples: [联想] throne王座，王位，把最后一个字母e反转就是g，变成了throng,意为国王转过身来面对被统治的“一大群”群众。【串记】flock 羊群；clan 族群；throng 人群；school 鱼群；herd 牛群；swarm 蜂群；pack 狼群throne 王位
英 [θrɒŋ] 美 [θrɔːŋ]
n.人群；一大群；大量v.群集；挤满

(1) A patient throng was waiting in silence.(2) She had to press through the throng to reach the stage.(3) He was met by a throng of journalists and photographers.(4) The rapid influx of well-meaning aid agencies that now throng the dusty remnants of Port-au-Prince has contributed to the confusion.(5) Here is a throng of vessels and a harbour life that in the West you see only in turn-of-the-last-century photogravures of San Francisco, Marseille or Brixham.(6) The rapid influx of well-meaning aid agencies that now throng the dusty remnants of Port-au-Prince has contributed to the confusion.(7) The airport was thronged with holiday-makers.(8) The lane was thronged with shoppers.(9) Passengers thronged the station waiting for their trains.

(1) 一大群人耐心地静候着。(2) 她不得不穿过拥挤的人群走上舞台。(3) 他受到一大群记者和摄影师的迎接。(4) 迅速涌入的救援机构出于善心帮助，但大量群集在太子港的废墟之中却是乱上添乱。(5) 在西方，这样大量的船队和海港生活只有在上个世纪有关圣佛郎西斯科，马赛，布里克瑟姆的凹板印刷照片上才能看见。(6) 迅速涌入的救援机构出于善心帮助，但大量群集在太子港的废墟之中却是乱上添乱。(7) 飞机场挤满了去度假的人。(8) 这条狭窄的街上挤满了购物的人群。(9) 乘客们拥挤在火车站上等候乘车。

translation:
prep. （表示时间）自始至终; 在…期间; 遍及…地域; 遍及…场所
adv. 处处; 始终; 在所有方面

分布：贯穿(32%)，到处(25%)，自始至终(23%)，遍及(20%)


prep.遍及,贯穿ad.到处,自始至终,彻底They painted the house throughout.他们把房子全都油漆了一遍.



preposition adverb  ESSENTIAL  ■in every part, or during the whole period of time 在各处；自始至终
•People throughout the country are out of work.全国各地的人们都失去了工作。

•He yawned throughout the performance.演出期间他一直在打哈欠。

•The school has been repainted throughout.学校各处都重新粉刷了一遍。




adv. 自始至终，到处；全部
 - everywhere, around, wholly, about
prep. 贯穿，遍及
 - over all
examples: 英 [θruː'aʊt] 美 [θruː'aʊt]
prep.遍及；贯穿adv.自始至终；到处

(1) The disease spread throughout the country.(2) She remained cheerful throughout the trip.(3) It snowed throughout the night.(4) Throughout history empires have waxed and waned.(5) The prince remained loyal throughout.(6) The material is flawed throughout.(7) The building is well built throughout.
(1) 这种疾病蔓延全国。(2) 旅行中她始终兴致勃勃。(3) 雪整整下了一夜。(4) 历史上各个帝国革故鼎新均有兴衰。(5) 王子自始至终忠贞不渝。(6) 这种材料到处是裂缝。(7) 这栋楼房处处建造得良好。
[sound:youdao-ba22acde-8f13b2cd-c9f34fd0-1d3e25cc-b11b2a2d.mp3]

translation:
vi. 投掷; 丢; 抛
n. 投掷的距离; 丢
vt. 掷（色子）; 抛; 猛动（头、臂、腿）; 使处于，使限于

时态：threw, thrown, throwing, throws
分布：扔(50%)，抛(19%)，投(14%)，掷(10%)，投掷(7%)


→来自中英语 thrawan,转动，旋转，拧，来自 Proto-Germanic*threw,转动，来自 tere,弯， 转，词源同 turn,torque.词义由旋转引申为扔，来自投掷的姿势和动作。
vt.扔;使突然陷入;使困惑n.投掷(距离)I threw a row of arrows, which narrowly passed the narrow-minded man's eyebrows.我掷了一排箭,箭紧擦心胸狭窄的人的眉毛而过.



US [θroʊ] verb (threw, thrown)SEND THROUGH AIR  投   ESSENTIAL  intransitive or transitive ■to send something through the air with force, especially by a sudden movement of the arm 投；抛；掷；扔
•My friend threw the ball back over the fence.我朋友把球从围栏上掷了回去。

•The coat was thrown over the back of the chair.大衣丢在椅背上。

•[R] She threw herself into a chair, exhausted.她筋疲力尽地倒在椅子上。

•The rider was thrown as the horse jumped the fence.马跳过栅栏时骑手被甩了下来。

•He threw a punch at (= hit) his attacker.他向攻击他的人猛击一拳。
throw a glance/look ■to look quickly or suddenly 扫一眼，瞥一眼
•The boy threw a frightened look in the direction of the house.男孩朝房子那边惊恐地看了一眼。

UK [θrəʊ] US [θroʊ] verb (threw, thrown)MOVE QUICKLY  快速移动  transitive ■to cause to move or act quickly or carelessly 猛推；猛动
•She threw back her hair.她把头发往后甩了甩。

•David threw open the window to get some air.戴维用力推开窗户，想透透气。

UK [θrəʊ] US [θroʊ] verb (threw, thrown)CONFUSE  使困惑  transitive ■to confuse or shock someone or cause difficulty for them 使困惑；使惊讶；难住
•I wasn't expecting a visitor. I was really thrown.我没想到会有人来，我真是措手不及。

•The news of the coup threw them into a state of panic.政变的消息使他们陷入了恐慌。

UK [θrəʊ] US [θroʊ] verb (threw, thrown)PARTY  聚会，派对  throw a party ■to have a party 举办派对
•Janet threw a party for Jack's fiftieth birthday.珍妮特为庆祝杰克50岁生日举办了派对。

UK [θrəʊ] US [θroʊ] verb (threw, thrown)ANGER  愤怒  throw a fit/tantrum ■to experience and show a strong feeling of anger, especially suddenly 大发脾气
•My mother threw a fit when she saw what a mess we'd made of her kitchen.我母亲看到我们把她的厨房弄得一团糟时，她大发脾气。

UK [θrəʊ] US [θroʊ] verb (threw, thrown)SHAPE  成形  transitive ■specializedto shape clay on a special round table that spins （在拉坯轮上）把…拉成坯
UK [θrəʊ] US [θroʊ] verb (threw, thrown)throw sth back in sb's face ■to say unkind things about someone's behaviour in the past during an argument 当（某人的）面重提（旧帐）
•She threw all his failures back in his face.她当着他的面把他过去的那些失败经历都抖搂出来。

UK [θrəʊ] US [θroʊ] verb (threw, thrown)throw sb back on their own resources ■to force someone to take care of themselves without help from others 丢下不管（强迫某人自己照顾自己）
•When both his parents died, the boy was thrown back on his own resources.这个男孩的父母都逝世后，他不得不自己照顾自己。

UK [θrəʊ] US [θroʊ] verb (threw, thrown)throw the book at sb ■to severely punish someone 狠狠责罚（某人）
•After the accident, the safety inspector threw the book at the company directors.事故发生之后，安全督查员狠狠批评了公司的管理人员。

UK [θrəʊ] US [θroʊ] verb (threw, thrown) throw caution to the wind /winds ■to do something without worrying about the risk or negative results 不顾风险，鲁莽行事
•I threw caution to the wind and bought the most expensive one.我甚么也不顾，买了最贵的那个。

UK [θrəʊ] US [θroʊ] verb (threw, thrown) throw cold water on sth ■to be negative about someone's ideas or plans 给（想法或计划）泼冷水
•You're always throwing cold water on my suggestions.你总是对我的建议泼冷水。

UK [θrəʊ] US [θroʊ] verb (threw, thrown) throw (sb) a curve  (ball) US Australian informal ■to surprise someone with something that is difficult or unpleasant to deal with 让…摸不透；使…惊讶（以某事让某人惊讶，这种事情难于处理或处理起来很麻烦）
•The weather threw a curve at their barbecue and they had to eat indoors.老天给他们的烧烤野餐出了一个难题，他们只好在室内进餐。

UK [θrəʊ] US [θroʊ] verb (threw, thrown) throw good money after bad ■to waste money by spending more money on something that you have already spent money on and which is no good 把钱投入无底洞，花冤枉钱
•Trying to fix that old car would just be throwing good money after bad.试图修理那辆旧车简直就是花冤枉钱。

UK [θrəʊ] US [θroʊ] verb (threw, thrown)throw in the towel/sponge ■to admit defeat 认输
UK [θrəʊ] US [θroʊ] verb (threw, thrown)throw (your) money/cash around informal disapproving ■to spend money, especially in an obvious and careless way, on things that are not necessary 挥霍金钱
•He lost his job, but still seems to have plenty of money to throw around.他丢了工作，但看来好像还有足够的钱挥霍。

UK [θrəʊ] US [θroʊ] verb (threw, thrown)throw money at sth ■to spend a lot of money on trying to solve a problem 花大笔钱在…上
•We won't solve this problem by throwing money at it.我们不会为解决这问题投入大量资金。

UK [θrəʊ] US [θroʊ] verb (threw, thrown)throw sb off balance ■to confuse or upset someone for a short time by saying or doing something that they are not expecting 使（某人）心烦意乱；使（某人）乱了方寸
•The question threw him off balance for a moment.那个问题让他一时不知如何作答。

UK [θrəʊ] US [θroʊ] verb (threw, thrown)throw sb to the dogs ■to allow someone to be criticized or attacked, often in order to protect yourself from being criticized or attacked 弃卒保车；弃…而自保（让某人受到批评或攻击，常是为了保护自己免受批评或攻击）
•I really felt as if I'd been thrown to the dogs just to save other people's reputations.我感到自己像是个为了挽救其他人的声誉而被弃掉的棋子。

UK [θrəʊ] US [θroʊ] verb (threw, thrown) throw up your hands in horror / despair ■to show that you are shocked or that you disagree strongly with something 感到惊恐／绝望；强烈反对
•They threw up their hands in horror at his suggestion.他们强烈反对他的建议。

UK [θrəʊ] US [θroʊ] verb (threw, thrown)throw your voice ■to make something which is not real, such as a toy, seem to be speaking 使开口说话，为配音
UK [θrəʊ] US [θroʊ] verb (threw, thrown)throw your weight around/about disapproving ■to act as if you have a lot of power or authority 耀武扬威，作威作福
UK [θrəʊ] US [θroʊ] verb (threw, thrown)  Phrasal Verbs   [R] throw yourself at sb informal disapproving ■to make it very obvious to someone that you want a sexual relationship with them 向（某人）献媚，勾引（某人）
•I don't know what it is about John, but women just seem to throw themselves at him.我不懂约翰究竟有甚么招数，反正女人似乎总是对他投怀送抱。

UK [θrəʊ] US [θroʊ] verb (threw, thrown)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] throw sth away/out  ADVANCED  ■to get rid of something that you do not want any more 丢弃，扔掉
•So when are you going to throw away those old magazines?那么你打算甚么时候把那些旧杂志扔掉？

UK [θrəʊ] US [θroʊ] verb (threw, thrown)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] throw sth away ■to waste a skill or opportunity 浪费掉（本领）；错过（机会）
•You've spent three years studying - don't throw it all away.你已经花了三年时间学习——不要荒废。

UK [θrəʊ] US [θroʊ] verb (threw, thrown)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] throw sth in ■If a person or business selling goods throws something in, they provide it for free when you buy something else from them 免费添加，额外奉送■1. When I bought my new glasses, they threw in a free pair of prescription sunglasses.
throw 1	 我买新眼镜时，他们额外免费赠送了一副处方太阳镜。
UK [θrəʊ] US [θroʊ] verb (threw, thrown)  Phrasal Verbs   throw your self into sth ■to do something actively and enthusiastically 投身于；积极从事
•She's thrown herself into this new job.她满怀热情地做起了这份新工作。

UK [θrəʊ] US [θroʊ] verb (threw, thrown)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] throw sth off CLOTHES  ■If you throw off your clothes, you take them off quickly and carelessly 匆匆脱下（衣服）
•They threw off their clothes and jumped in the sea.他们扯下衣服跳入大海。
ILLNESS  ■to stop suffering from a cold or other illness that is not serious 摆脱（感冒等小病）
•I can't seem to throw off this cold.我这次感冒好像根治不了。

UK [θrəʊ] US [θroʊ] verb (threw, thrown)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] throw sth/sb off ■to escape from something or someone following you 摆脱，甩掉
•They threw the police off the scent by travelling on false passports.他们用假护照旅行甩掉了员警。

UK [θrəʊ] US [θroʊ] verb (threw, thrown)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] throw sth open OBJECT  ■to open something which was closed, usually suddenly and completely 突然打开；完全打开
•She drew back the curtains and threw open all the windows.她拉开窗帘，打开所有窗户。
EVENT  ■to allow people to enter or become involved in an event 使…向公众开放
•The competition has been thrown open to the public.这项竞赛已经对公众开放。

UK [θrəʊ] US [θroʊ] verb (threw, thrown)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] throw sth out GET RID OF  ■see throw sth away/out NOT ACCEPT  ■If people in authority throw out a plan, idea, case, etc. they refuse to accept or use it 拒绝接受，否决（计划或想法）；拒绝受理（案件）
•The case was thrown out by the courts due to lack of evidence.由于缺乏证据，法庭拒绝受理该案。
 throw the baby out with the bath - water ■to lose valuable ideas or things in your attempt to get rid of what is not wanted 把婴儿和洗澡水一起倒掉；把精华和糟粕一起丢掉
UK [θrəʊ] US [θroʊ] verb (threw, thrown)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] throw sb out ■to force someone to leave a college, school, house or organization 开除，赶走，解雇（某人）
•She was thrown out of college for not attending lectures.她因为不上课被大学开除了。

•They had a big row and she threw him out (= made him leave the house).他们大吵了一次，之后她把他赶出家门。

UK [θrəʊ] US [θroʊ] verb (threw, thrown)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] throw sb over old-fashioned , informal ■to finish a relationship with someone and start one with another person 甩掉，抛弃（某人）
•She threw him over for a richer man.她把他甩掉，找了一个更有钱的男人。

UK [θrəʊ] US [θroʊ] verb (threw, thrown)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] throw sth together informal ■to make something quickly without special care or preparation 仓促拼凑，匆匆做成
•I had to throw a meal together at the last minute.我只好赶紧忙做了一顿饭。

UK [θrəʊ] US [θroʊ] verb (threw, thrown)  Phrasal Verbs   [usually passive] throw sb together ■If two people are thrown together, they meet each other in a way that was not planned, or events cause them to meet unexpectedly 使（某人）不期而遇
•We were thrown together by chance at a conference.我们是在一次会上偶然相识的。

UK [θrəʊ] US [θroʊ] verb (threw, thrown)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] throw (sth) up informal  ADVANCED  ■to vomit 呕吐
•I spent the night throwing up.我吐了一夜。

•He threw up his breakfast all over the back seat of the car.他把早餐吐在汽车后座上，到处都是。

UK [θrəʊ] US [θroʊ] verb (threw, thrown)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] throw sth up JOB  UK informal ■If you throw up your job, you choose to leave it or stop doing it 辞去，放弃（工作）
•He's thrown up his job and gone off to Africa to work for a children's charity.他辞掉工作，去非洲为一家儿童慈善机构工作。
IDEA  ■to produce new problems or ideas 产生（新问题或新想法）
•The meeting threw up some interesting ideas.这次会上提出了一些有趣的想法。

UK [θrəʊ] US [θroʊ] noun THROWING  投掷  countable ■when you throw something 投；掷
•a throw of the dice掷骰子

UK [θrəʊ] US [θroʊ] noun EACH  每次  a throw only singular informal ■used to mean each thing or for each time 每一个；每一次
•We could get a coffee in there but they charge two quid a throw.我们可以在那里买到咖啡，不过他们每份要卖两英镑。





fling, throw, cast, heave, toss, hurl, pitch

这组词都有“抛、投、掷”的意思，其区别是：
fling: 指用力投掷，或因感情激动而粗暴地或漫无目的地扔东西。
throw: 普通用词，使用广泛，仅指用力抛掷，不涉及动作方式或感情色彩。
cast: 常可与throw互换，指迅速扔出一个重量较轻的物体。
heave: 指把重物举起后扔出。
toss: 指无什么目的地、轻轻地、随意地掷或扔，所扔掷的东西一般都比较轻。
hurl: 通常指用力投掷，动作迅猛，所投掷的距离也较远。
pitch: 指随意地、轻轻地掷或扔，侧重方向性和有明确的目标。


vt. 投；抛；掷
 - cast, pitch
vi. 抛；投掷
 - pitch
n. 投掷；冒险
 - putting, cast, risk, venture, adventure
examples: 英 [θrəʊ] 美 [θroʊ]
v.扔；投；掷；抛n.抛；投掷

(1) The trees threw long shadows across the lawn.(2) It's your turn to throw the dice.(3) He threw the stone in the air.(4) My nephew lives only a stone's throw from my house.(5) What are the requirements for the throw itself?
(1) 树在草坪上都投下长长的影子。(2) 轮到你掷骰子了。(3) 他把石头抛向空中。(4) 我侄子住得离我家很近。(5) 对投掷本身的要求有哪些?
[sound:youdao-3fa20e30-f75738bd-aec05989-9bcada61-67da97af.mp3]

translation:
vt. & vi. 猛推; 逼迫; 强行推入; 延伸
n. 刺; 推力; [军]突击; [地]逆断层
vi. 插入; 用力向某人刺去; 猛然或用力推

时态：thrust, thrusting, thrusts
分布：推力(80%)，刺(14%)，插入(5%)，要旨(1%)


→来自古诺斯语 thrysta,猛推，用力冲挤，来自 Proto-Germanic*thrustijanan,猛推，冲，可能来 自 treud,猛推，冲，词源同 threat,extrude.-st,表反复。
vt.插入;猛推n.插,推力vi.刺,戳,冲The exhausted man and the trustful guy thrust a knife into the rusty crust.精疲力竭的男子和深信不疑的家伙将一把刀子刺向生锈的外壳.
【记】th死，rust锈：用rust的剑thrust你。



verb intransitive or transitive [usually + adv/prep] (thrust, thrust)■to push suddenly and strongly 推挤；刺；戳；插入
•She thrust the money into his hand.她把钱塞进他手中。

•They thrust a microphone in front of me and fired questions at me.他们把麦克风推到我面前，不断向我发问。

•She thrust the papers at me (= towards me).她把报纸塞给我。

•The bodyguards thrust past the crowd to get at the cameraman.保镖挤过人群直扑摄影师。

[θrʌst] verb intransitive or transitive [usually + adv/prep] (thrust, thrust)  Phrasal Verbs   [often passive] thrust sth on/upon sb ■to force someone to accept or deal with something 强迫（某人）接受；强迫（某人）应对
•Fatherhood had been thrust on him.他身不由己当了父亲。

[θrʌst] noun IDEA  思想  only singular ■the main idea, subject or opinion that is discussed or written about 要点，要旨，中心点
•The main thrust of her argument was that women are compromised by the demands of childcare.她的主要论点是妇女受到需要照顾孩子的拖累。

[θrʌst] noun PUSH  推  countable ■a strong push 猛推；刺uncountable specialized ■the driving force produced by, for example, an aircraft engine 牵引力，驱动力




thrust, pierce, penetrate, prick, stab

这组词都有“刺入，穿透”的意思，其区别是：
thrust: 本义是使某物进入或把某物刺进或使之穿透某物，有时侧重穿透、刺入。
pierce: 多指人为地用刀刺、剑等尖锐东西刺穿或刺入某物。
penetrate: 较正式用词，可指用任何工具穿入或穿透，也可指光线、声音等透过物体。
prick: 一般指用针等刺穿。
stab: 主要指利器刺入、刺伤，如用匕首、短刀等。



thrust, propel, shove, push

这组词都有“推、推动”的意思，其区别是：
thrust: 常指迅猛地一推或突然有力地推进，侧重速度。
propel: 侧重指靠外力把人或物稳定、持续地向前推进。
shove: 一般指猛或费力地推开或移动人或物。
push: 普通用词，指用突然的力量把人或物推向前进、推开或推到另一位置上。


n. [力] 推力；刺
 - pushing force, spine
vt. 插；插入；推挤
 - build in, plug in
vi. 插入；用向某人刺去；猛然或用力推
 - intervene, build in
examples: [串记] 我信任（trust）你，你却把我扎（thrust）了
英 [θrʌst] 美 [θrʌst]
v.刺；插入；推挤n.刺；推力；要旨

(1) The mugger thrust at his victim with a knife.(2) The murderer killed her by thrusting a knife in her back.(3) He thrust his hands into his pockets.(4) We thrust our way through the crowd.(5) We thrust ourselves forward into the bus.(6) The fencer parried his opponent's thrust.(7) He killed her with a thrust of the knife.(8) This is the ultimate thrust the engine can generate.(9) What was the thrust of his argument?(10) The whole thrust of the project was to make money.
(1) 抢劫者用刀子向受害人刺去。(2) 凶手把刀刺进她的背部，杀害了她。(3) 他把两手插入衣袋里。(4) 我们用力挤过人群。(5) 我们用力挤上了公共汽车。(6) 击剑手挡开了对手的猛刺。(7) 他把她一刀刺死了。(8) 这是这台发动机所能产生的最大推力。(9) 他的论据的要点是什麽?(10) 计划的核心在于赢利。
[sound:youdao-3fbfa270-3ee7a59e-5a21bf38-8ec59df2-3b6216b4.mp3]

translation:
n. 拇指; （手套的）拇指部份
vi. 翘起拇指请求搭乘（过路汽车），示意请求搭便车; 翻阅
vt. 翻阅; 作搭车手势; 用拇指翻脏[翻坏]（书页等）

时态：thumbed, thumbing, thumbs
分布：拇指(96%)，翻阅(3%)，示意要求搭车(1%)


→来自古英语 thuma,拇指，来自 Proto-Germanic*thumon,拇指，来自 tum,鼓起，来自 teue, 鼓起，词源同 tumid,thigh.插入字母 b,比较 number,numerate.
n.拇指v.示意要求搭车;迅速翻阅Thus the enthusiastic dumb man thumbed the humble man's umbrella.于是热情的哑巴用拇指拨弄谦卑男子的伞.



noun countable  ADVANCED  ■the short thick finger on the side of your hand which makes it possible to hold and pick things up easily 拇指
[θʌm] noun countable all (fingers and) thumbs informal ■to be very awkward with your hands 笨手笨脚
•Can you untangle this thread for me? I'm all thumbs today.你能帮我解开这个线结吗？我今天手指不灵活。

[θʌm] noun countable thumbs down informal ■used to show disapproval of something 拇指向下；不赞成，反对
•They've given our plan the thumbs down (= They have disagreed with our plan).他们不赞成我们的计划。

[θʌm] noun countable thumbs up informal ■used to show approval of something 竖起大拇指；赞成，接受
•So it's the thumbs up for Brighton's latest night club.那么这就是对布赖顿最近开的那家夜总会表示认可了。

[θʌm] noun countable under sb's thumb ■under someone's control 在（某人的）支配下
•He's got the committee firmly under his thumb - they agree to whatever he asks.他已牢牢掌控委员会，他们同意他提出的任何要求。

[θʌm] verb thumb a lift informal ■to stand near the edge of a road and hold out your hand with the thumb raised as a signal for a vehicle to stop and take you somewhere 竖起拇指要求免费搭车
•We thumbed a lift to London.我们搭便车去了伦敦。
thumb your nose at sb/sth ■to show no respect, or to raise the tip of your thumb to the end of your nose to show that you do not respect somebody 对…嗤之以鼻，蔑视
•He has thumbed his nose at authority all his life.他一生都藐视权威。

[θʌm] verb   Phrasal Verbs   thumb through sth ■to turn the pages of a book, magazine, or a document quickly and only read small parts of it 匆匆翻阅，浏览
•"Have you read the report?" "Well, I thumbed through it quickly on the train."“你看过报告了吗？”“嗯，我在火车上匆匆翻阅过。”




vt. 翻阅；以拇指拨弄；作搭车手势；笨拙地摆弄
 - turn over, browse through
examples: 英 [θʌm] 美 [θʌm]
n.拇指v.翻阅；示意要求搭车

(1) Don't suck your thumb; it's so dirty.(2) He caught his thumb in the door.(3) He thumbed through the address book looking for the number.(4) You ought to thumb through this art book sometime.(5) They managed to thumb a lift to Paris.(6) If we miss the last train we can always thumb a lift home.
(1) 别舔手指头，太脏了。(2) 他的拇指让门夹了。(3) 他翻阅地址簿，寻找号码。(4) 你什么时候应该浏览一下这本美术书。(5) 她们设法搭便车到达巴黎。(6) 如果我们赶不上末班火车，我们总可搭便车回家。
[sound:youdao-063c2a3f-92abe306-dae16e90-e7d0db92-e46f6700.mp3]

translation:
n. 雷声; 隆隆的响声
vi. 打雷
vt. & vi. 发出隆隆声; 轰隆隆地快速移动; 使快速移动; 怒喝

时态：thundered, thundering, thunders
分布：雷(67%)，雷声(25%)，打雷(6%)，大声喊出(1%)，轰隆地响(1%)


→来自古英语 thunor,雷电，雷声，雷神索尔，来自 Proto-Germanic*thunraz,打雷，来自 stene, 回响，打雷，可能为拟声词，词源同 astonish,Thursday.插入字母 d,可能是受 sound 影响。
n.雷(声);轰隆声v.打雷;大声说,吼叫The loud thunder gave me a fright.这声响雷吓了我一大跳.



US [-dɚ] noun  ADVANCED  uncountable ■the sudden loud noise which comes from the sky especially during a storm 雷，雷声
•a clap of thunder一声雷响

•thunder and lightning雷电
only singular ■a continuous loud noise 雷鸣般的响声，轰隆声
•I couldn't hear what he was saying over the thunder of the waterfall.瀑布震天响，我听不清他说的话。

UK ['θʌn.dər] US [-dɚ] verb intransitive ■When it thunders, a loud noise comes from the sky 打雷
•The sky grew dark and it started to thunder.天色变暗，开始打雷了。
intransitive + adverb or preposition ■to move, making a lot of noise 轰隆隆地移动
•The train thundered past, shaking the whole house.火车轰隆隆驶过，整座房子都晃动起来。
intransitive ■to shout angrily 怒吼
•[+ speech] "I never want to see you here again!" he thundered.“我再也不想在这里见到你！”他怒吼道。




n. [气象] 雷；轰隆声；恐吓
 - threat, intimidation
vi. 打雷；怒喝
 - fulminate
vt. 轰隆地发出；大声喊出
 - bark out, bellow out
examples: 英 ['θʌndə(r)] 美 ['θʌndər]
n.雷；雷声v.打雷；轰隆地响；大声喊出

(1) The thunder rumbled in the distance.(2) We could hear the thunder of distant guns.(3) My little dog always hides under the bed when it thunders.(4) An express train thundered through the station.(5) "Get out!" he thundered.(6) How dare you thunder out your orders at me?
(1) 远处雷声隆隆。(2) 我们可以听到远处炮声隆隆。(3) 我的小狗一听到打雷就藏到床底下。(4) 一辆快车轰隆隆地驶过车站。(5) “滚出去！”他大声吼到。(6) 你怎敢如此大声地对我发号施令？
[sound:youdao-bf84ad3c-96357ffa-44229977-b6bfe4be-5f005e22.mp3]

translation:
n. 星期四

分布：星期四(100%)


→来自古英语 thurresdaeg,星期四，字面意思即 Thor's Day,雷神索尔日。
n.星期四See you Thursday.星期四见.



US ['θɝ:z-] (written abbreviation Thur/Thurs) noun countable or uncountable  ESSENTIAL  ■the day of the week after Wednesday and before Friday 星期四
•We meet on the second Thursday of every month.我们每个月的第二个星期四见面。

•I'm having my hair cut after work on Thursday.星期四下班后我去理发。

•Thursday morning星期四上午
examples: 英 ['θɜːzdeɪ] 美 ['θɜːrzdeɪ]
n.星期四

(1) I'm usually free between Tuesday and Thursday.(2) The meeting is scheduled for Thursday.(3) She's due to arrive on Thursday. Meanwhile, what do we do?(4) The Brethren hold a prayer meeting every Thursday.(5) We have meetings every Thursday afternoon.
(1) 我通常在星期二至星期四有空。(2) 会议定于星期四举行。(3) 她预定星期四到达.(4) 教友每周四举行一次祷告会。(5) 我们每个星期四下午开会。
[sound:youdao-15ccc247-79487175-0d36d33f-52cadf5c-0e5444a1.mp3]

translation:
n. 钩号; 一瞬间; 壁虱; 钟的嘀嗒声
v. 发出滴答声; 在（纸）上打钩; 做出…举动

时态：ticked, ticking, ticks
分布：滴答声(24%)，蜱虫(18%)，一会儿(9%)，壁虱(9%)，勾号(9%)，滴答作响(6%)，运作(6%)，枕套(5%)，褥套(5%)，给…标记号(5%)，空转(4%)


→拟声词，模仿钟表滴答声，后引申词义打勾。
n.滴答声;勾号v.滴答响;打勾号于The tickler pricked a tick on the nickname Nickel.挠痒者在绰号"镍币"上刺了个勾号.



noun MARK  记号   IMPROVER  countable mainly UK (US usually check) ■a mark (✓) that shows that something is correct or has been done 核对号，钩号
•Put  a tick by/against the names of the people who have accepted the invitation.在接受邀请的人的姓名上打钩。

[tɪk] noun SHORT TIME  短时间  countable UK informal ■a very short time 一会儿
•Hold on/Hang on a  tick - I'm not quite ready.稍等一会儿——我还没准备好。

•I'll be with you in a  tick /in two  ticks.我马上就到。

[tɪk] noun SOUND  声音  countable usually singular ■the sound clocks and watches make every second （钟表发出的）滴答声
[tɪk] noun PAYING LATER  以后付款  on tick UK old-fashioned informal ■If you buy something on tick, you pay for it later. 赊购，赊帐
[tɪk] noun ANIMAL  动物  countable ■a very small creature like an insect which lives on and sucks the blood of other animals 蜱；壁虱
[tɪk] verb SOUND  声音  intransitive ■When a clock or watch ticks, it makes a sound every second. （钟表）发出滴答声
[tɪk] verb MARK  记号  transitive mainly UK (US usually check) ■to mark something with a tick 给…标记号，打上钩
•Tick (off) each item on the list as you complete it.每完成一个专案计划就在清单上把该专案计划打勾。

[tɪk] verb what makes sb tick ■If you know what makes someone tick, you understand why they behave the way they do. 使（某人）做…的原因
[tɪk] verb   Phrasal Verbs   tick away/by ■If time ticks away/by, it goes past （时间）流逝，一点一点过去
•With the final seconds ticking away, Milan scored a goal.米兰队在最后几秒钟进了一个球。

[tɪk] verb   Phrasal Verbs   tick sb off SPEAK SEVERELY  [M] UK informal ■to speak severely to and criticize someone who has done something wrong 责备，责骂（某人）
•I had to tick him off for being late again.他又迟到了，我得说说他。
ANNOY  US informal ■to annoy someone 使（某人）生气，使（某人）恼火
•It really ticks me off when she doesn't keep her promises.她不守信，令我特别生气。

[tɪk] verb   Phrasal Verbs   tick over ACTIVITY  ■If a business, job or system is ticking over, it continues to work but makes little progress （生意、工作或系统几乎没有进展地）进度缓慢
•I'll be able to keep things ticking over in the office until you get back.你回来之前我能够保持办公室工作基本运行。
ENGINE  ■If the engine of a vehicle is ticking over, the engine is operating slowly although the vehicle is not moving （引擎）空转
•I've left the car with the engine ticking over.我离开了汽车，让引擎空转着。




n. 滴答声；扁虱；记号；赊欠
 - marks, sign, click
vi. 发出滴答声；标以记号
 - tictoc
examples: 英 [tɪk] 美 [tɪk]
v.滴答作响；给…标记号；运作；空转n.滴答声；一会儿；勾号；壁虱；蜱虫；枕套；褥套；赊欠

(1) The clock ticks very loudly.(2) My watch doesn't tick because it's electronic.(3) The teacher ticks off a name on a list.(4) Listen carefully and tick the sentences which are correct.(5) That's what makes the world tick.(6) Buses and taxis tick over rather noisily.(7) I stopped the car but left the motor ticking over.(8) They could hear the regular tick of the clock.(9) There was a nice red tick in the margin.(10) Opposite his own name was a small tick.(11) The tick stops draining you and drops off after you're dead.

(1) 这只钟发出很响的滴答声。(2) 我的表不滴答作响,因为它是电子表。(3) 老师在名单上的一个名字旁打勾。(4) 认真听，并标记正确的句子。(5) 使世界持续活动的动力，就在于此。(6) 公共汽车和出租车空档慢转时噪音很大。(7) 我停住汽车，让发动机空转。(8) 他们能听见时钟有规律的滴答声。(9) 边上打了一个漂亮的红勾。(10) 紧接在他名字后面的是一个小对号。(11) 你死了以后壁虱才会停止吸你的血,掉下来。
[sound:youdao-6290be97-e2e2909f-73376cc2-f4a303f3-41c57ab0.mp3]

translation:
n. 潮汐; 潮流，趋势; 时机; 时期，季节
vt. 顺应潮水航行; 使随潮水漂行

时态：tided, tiding, tides
分布：潮水(36%)，潮流(21%)，潮汐(17%)，渡过(15%)，趋势(11%)


→来自古英语 tid,一段时间，时期，时节，来自 Proto-Germanic*tidiz,一段时间，来自 di-ti, 分开，切分，扩大格于 da-,分开，切开，词源同 time,deal.后用于指潮汐，潮水，因潮涨 潮落的规律而引申该词义。
n.潮,潮汐;潮流,趋势The tides slide on the tidy wide beach and collide each other.海潮在整洁宽阔的海滩上滑行并相互碰撞.



noun SEA  海洋   ADVANCED  countable ■the rise and fall of the sea that happens twice every day 潮汐；潮水
•high/low tide高／低潮

•The tide is out/in.潮退了／涨了。

[taɪd] noun CHANGE  变化  only singular literary ■a noticeable change in a situation or increase in a particular type of behaviour 潮流，趋势
•We must look for ways of stemming (= stopping) the rising tide of protest.我们必须想办法阻止日益高涨的抗议活动。

[taɪd] noun go/swim against the tide ■to not follow what everyone else is doing 逆潮流，反潮流
[taɪd] noun go/swim with the tide ■to follow what everyone else is doing 赶潮流；随大流
•I thought I'd just swim with the tide and leave when everyone else does.我想我会随大流，像别人一样离开。

[taɪd] verb   Phrasal Verbs   tide sb over (sth) ■to help someone to work or operate normally through a difficult period, usually by lending them money 使（某人）渡过难关，使（某人）捱过困难时期
•Can you lend me some money to tide me over till the weekend?你能借些钱帮我撑到周末吗？

•Have another piece of cake. It'll tide you over till supper.再吃块蛋糕吧，这样你就可以忍到吃晚饭的时间了。




n. 趋势， [海洋] 潮流；潮汐
 - tendency, direction, trend, stream, set
examples: 英 [taɪd] 美 [taɪd]
n.趋势；潮流；潮汐；潮水v.渡过；（使）随潮漂流

(1) For a moment the tide almost turned against him.(2) We should be naturalized to the new tide of the world.(3) It once again proves that no one can stem the tide of history.(4) The attraction of the moon for the earth causes the tide.(5) The children learn about the relationship between the moon and the tide.(6) As the tide receded we were able to look for shells.(7) The empty boat was washed away by the tide.(8) The loan is enough to tide them over the difficulties.(9) He will be willing to tide us over.(10) These supplies will be enough to tide us over the winter.
(1) 在短短的时间内，舆论的趋势几乎变得对他不利。(2) 我们必须顺应新的世界潮流。(3) 这再一次地证明，历史的潮流是谁也阻挡不住的。(4) 月亮对地球的引力引起潮汐。(5) 孩子们学习了月球与潮汐的关系。(6) 潮水退去，我们就能寻找贝壳了。(7) 空船被潮水冲走。(8) 这笔贷款足以使他们渡过难关。(9) 他愿意帮助我们渡过难关。(10) 这些粮食将足够使我们过冬。
[sound:youdao-d8a3e72e-11403573-298aae50-17512fae-43f28b8d.mp3]

translation:
adj. 整洁的，整齐的; （数量）相当大的; 相当好的; 健康的
n. 盛零碎物品的容器; 椅子的背罩
vt. & vi. 使整洁; 弄整齐; 使有条理; 整理，收拾

时态：tidied, tidying, tidies
分布：整理(43%)，收拾(26%)，整洁的(19%)，整齐的(10%)，使整洁(2%)


→来自 tide,时令，季节，-y,形容词后缀，对应 timely.即适时的，当令的。引申词义情况好的， 整洁的，整齐的。
a.整洁的,整齐的v.整理,收拾The tides slide on the tidy wide beach and collide each other.海潮在整洁宽阔的海滩上滑行并相互碰撞.
【反】slovenly（adj 懒散的；不修边幅的）



adjective ORDERED  整齐的   IMPROVER  ■having everything ordered and arranged in the right place, or liking to keep things like this 整齐的；整洁的，有条理的
•The house was clean and tidy.房子干净整洁。

•My flatmate isn't very tidy.我的室友不怎么爱整洁。

•neat and tidy整整齐齐

•a tidy solution条理分明的解决方法

['taɪ.di] adjective LARGE  大的  [before noun] informal ■(of amounts of money) large （款额）巨大的
•His business deals make him a tidy sum.他做生意赚了一大笔钱。

['taɪ.di] noun a desk/car/sink, etc. tidy ■a small container for a few objects, that makes it easier for you to keep your desk, car, etc. tidy 写字枱杂物箱／汽车杂物箱／洗涤槽的过滤网罩等
['taɪ.di] verb intransitive or transitive  ADVANCED  ■to make a place or a collection of things tidy 整理；收拾
•Tidy (up) these papers before you leave, please.请把这些档整理好再走。

•I'm tired of asking you to tidy your room (up).老是叫你收拾房间，我都厌烦了。

•Have you tidied up yet, kids?孩子，你们收拾好了吗？

['taɪ.di] verb intransitive or transitive   Phrasal Verbs   [M] tidy sth away ■to put things back in drawers, cupboards and other places where they are kept, after you have used them 将…收起来，将…放回原处
•The children were expected to tidy away their toys before bedtime.孩子们要在睡觉前把玩具收拾好。





orderly, tidy, neat, trim

这组词都有“整齐的，整洁的”的意思，其区别是：
orderly: 语义比上述几个词强，最常用。指把复杂细微的东西按其内在联系安排整齐，侧重井井有条。
tidy: 侧重整齐，井然有序。
neat: 指人或物外表既清洁又整齐。
trim: 着重因线条清晰、比例匀称而使外观呈现出紧凑和精确、美观。


adj. 整齐的；相当大的
 - considerable, ordered, regular, straight
vt. 整理；收拾；弄整齐
 - arrange, sort things out
vi. 整理；收拾
 - sort things out, put in order
examples: 英 ['taɪdi] 美 ['taɪdi]
adj.整齐的；整洁的；相当大的vt.整理；使整洁vi.整理；收拾

(1) She keeps her house very tidy.(2) They sat in her neat and tidy kitchen.(3) He has a tidy mind.(4) Her clothes were clean and tidy.(5) His room is in a clutter so I have to tidy it up.(6) You'd better tidy up before the guests arrive.(7) Make your room as tidy as possible.(8) Mother always keeps the house clean and tidy.
(1) 她保持她的住所整整齐齐。(2) 他们坐在她那干净整齐的厨房里。(3) 他的思维有条理。(4) 她的衣服干净整洁。(5) 他的房间乱七八糟的，我不得不整理一下。(6) 客人们到达前,你最好先把东西整理一下。(7) 将你的房间收拾得尽量整洁一些。(8) 妈总是把房间收拾得干净整齐。
[sound:youdao-4cd969e4-8da6fc63-2ad43118-32abaa2e-bed771dd.mp3]

translation:
n. 关系; 领带，绳子; 平局; 束缚，限制
vt. （用线、绳等）系; （在线、绳上）打结; 连接; 与…成平局
vi. 打结，系上; 平局; 被用带（或绳子等）系住

时态：tied, tying, ties
分布：领带(49%)，系(29%)，绳(8%)，打结(4%)，束缚(3%)，捆绑(2%)，约束(2%)，不分胜负(1%)，连结(1%)，使人结合在一起的事物(1%)


→来自古英语 teag,绳子，带子，来自 Proto-Germanic*taugo,拉，来自 deuk,拉，词源同 tow,conduct.并引申诸相关词义。
n.领带;联系,关系,纽带;束缚v.扎,系,捆The lying liar lied to the dying diet maker that the tie was dyed blue.躺着的说谎者对临死的食疗制作者谎称带子染成了兰色.



verb (tying, tied, tied)FASTEN  系   ESSENTIAL  intransitive or transitive ■to fasten together two ends of a piece of string or other long thin material, or to (cause to) hold together with a long, thin piece of string, material, etc. 打结；系，缚，捆，扎
•Could you tie this piece of string for me?你能帮我把这个绳子打个结吗？

•This skirt ties at the waist.这条连衣裙是在腰间系带的。

•She tied the ribbon tightly in a bow/knot.她把丝带打成一个紧紧的蝴蝶结。

•I tie my hair back when it's hot.天热时我就把头发系在脑后。

•Tie (up) your shoelaces, or you'll trip over.把鞋带系好，不然会摔跤的。
be tied to sth/sb ■If you are tied to a job, place or person, you are forced to stay with them 束缚，约束，限制
•I felt tied to the job while I had a mortgage to pay.因为有按揭贷款要还，我觉得自己被这份工作束缚住了。

[taɪ] verb (tying, tied, tied)RELATE  相关  transitive ■to relate to or connect to 与…相关
•Is the allergy tied to dairy products, for example?比如说，过敏症与奶制品有关系吗？

•Can you tie his behaviour up with anything that's happened recently?你认为他的行为与最近发生的甚么事有关联吗？

[taɪ] verb (tying, tied, tied)FINISH EQUAL  以平局结束  intransitive ■to finish at the same time or score the same number of points, etc. in a competition as someone or something else （比赛中）打成平局，不分胜负
•Jane and I tied (for first place) in the spelling test.在拼写比赛中（争夺第一名时）我和简打成平手。

•We tied with a team from the south in the championships.在锦标赛中我们和一支南方队打成平手。

[taɪ] verb (tying, tied, tied)tie sb (up) in knots informal ■to confuse someone 使（某人）困惑，把（某人）弄糊涂
•The Director of Studies tied me up in knots by asking tricky questions.教务主任问了一些很难回答的问题，把我弄得头昏脑胀。

[taɪ] verb (tying, tied, tied)tie the knot informal ■to get married 结婚
•So when are you two going to tie the knot?那么你俩甚么时候结婚呢？

[taɪ] verb (tying, tied, tied)tied to your mother's / wife's apron strings disapproving ■If you say that someone, especially a man, is tied to his mother's/wife's apron strings, it means that he is strongly influenced and controlled by that person 受母亲／老婆的管束
•George never comes out with the rest of us - he's tied to his wife's apron strings.乔治从不和我们一起外出——玛莎／他妻子对他管束很严。

[taɪ] verb (tying, tied, tied)  Phrasal Verbs   tie sb down LIMIT  [M often passive] informal ■to limit someone's freedom 限制，束缚（某人）
•He's tied down by having to work every Saturday.他星期六都被工作绑住了。

•We'd like to travel more, but having children at school really ties us down.我们想去更多的地方旅游，可是孩子要上学，把我们绑住了。
GET DECISION  [M] informal ■to make someone give you a clear decision 使（某人）明确表态
•I'll try to tie her down on her plans.我会设法让她把计划确定下来。

[taɪ] verb (tying, tied, tied)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] tie (sth) in ■When ideas or statements tie in, they agree or are closely connected, and if you tie them in, you make them agree or connect closely （使）相一致；（使）有联系
•I can't tie in what he said today with what he told me last week.他今天说的与上周他告诉我的根本就不是一回事。

[taɪ] verb (tying, tied, tied)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] tie (sth) in with sth ■to plan an event or activity so that it combines with or happens at the same time as another, or to be planned in this way （使）同时发生
•We're trying to tie our holiday in with Simon's lecture tour.我们试图把我们的假期与赛门的巡回讲学安排在一起。

[taɪ] verb (tying, tied, tied)  Phrasal Verbs   tie sb up FASTENED  [M] ■to make a person unable to move by tying a rope or something similar around their body or part of their body 把（某人）捆绑起来
•The burglars had tied him up (to the bed).窃贼们把他绑了起来（窃贼们把他绑在床上）。
NOT AVAILABLE  ■When someone is tied up, they are busy or are prevented from doing something, such as speaking to someone or going somewhere, because they are involved in another event or activity 把（某人）缠住，使（某人）无法脱身
•I'm afraid we can't meet till Wednesday - I'm tied up on Monday and Tuesday.恐怕我们要到周三才能碰头——我周一和周二都脱不开身。

•Mrs Moran is tied up in a meeting at the moment, but I'll ask her to call you later.莫兰夫人现在正开会脱不开身，我会告诉她稍后给你打电话。

[taɪ] verb (tying, tied, tied)  Phrasal Verbs   tie sth up FASTENED  ■to fasten something together using string, rope or something similar （用绳子、线等）捆扎
•Could you tie up the parcel for me?帮我捆好这个包裹好吗？
NOT AVAILABLE  ■to cause something, often money or possessions, not to be available for use 占用（常指资金、产业等）
•All my money is tied up in property.我所有的资金都投在房地产上，无法动用。

•He tied up the printer all morning, printing out his reports.他整个早上一直占着列印机列印他的报告。

[taɪ] noun countable FASTENING  系   ADVANCED  (US also necktie) ■a long thin piece of material that is worn under a shirt collar, especially by men, and tied in a knot at the front 领带
•He always wears a jacket and tie to work.他上班时总是穿西服打领带。
 ADVANCED  ■any piece of string, plastic, metal, etc. which is used to fasten or hold together something （绑扎东西用的）带子，绳子
•Can you see the ties for the rubbish bags in the cupboard?你看到柜子里扎垃圾袋的带子吗？

[taɪ] noun countable CONNECTION  关系  ties [plural]  ADVANCED  ■the friendly feelings that people have for other people, or special connections with places 纽带；关系，联系
•Family ties are weaker if you move a long way away.离家太远就会与家人疏远。

•I no longer feel any ties with my home town.我对我的家乡再也没有任何亲切感了。

•He urged governments worldwide to break diplomatic ties with the new regime.他敦促世界各国政府断绝与新政权的外交关系。

[taɪ] noun countable EQUAL FINISH  以平局结束  ■when two or more people finish at the same time or score the same number of points 不分胜负，平局
•It's a tie for first place.两人并列第一。

•They have changed the scoring system because there have been too many ties.因为常常出现不分胜负的结果，他们改变了计分制。





chain, tie, secure, bind, fasten

这组词都有“扎牢、捆、绑”的意思，其区别是：
chain: 专指用链条或金属环将某人或某物锁住或系住。
tie: 普通用词，指用绳索等将东西扎紧捆牢。
secure: 指将某物紧紧地固定起来，使之完全无损。
bind: 多指把两个或两个以上的人或物牢牢地系或扎在一起。
fasten: 指把某物牢牢地拴在、钉在或锁在另一物上，使不能任意移动。


vt. 系；约束；打结；与…成平局
 - restrict, hold oneself in
vi. 打结；不分胜负；被用带（或绳子等）系住
 - knot
n. 领带；平局；鞋带；领结；不分胜负
 - draw, necktie
examples: 英 [taɪ] 美 [taɪ]
n.束缚；使人结合在一起的事物；领带；绳；不分胜负v.系；约束；捆绑；打结；连结

(1) He doesn't want any ties; that's why he never married.(2) Pets can be a tie when you want to go away on holiday.(3) The firm has ties with an American corporation.(4) They want to loosen their ties with Britain.(5) He took off his jacket and loosened his tie.(6) He wore a pale blue shirt and a tie to match.(7) There are ties for sealing plastic bags behind the door.(8) Each team scored twice and the game ended in a tie.(9) I was all thumbs this morning. I couldn't even tie my shoelaces.(10) Please tie the safety belt well because the airplane will be taken off.(11) We must tie him down to the contract.(12) I need a length of wire or string to tie it with.(13) Does this sash tie in front or at the back?(14) The girl tied the ends of the thread.

(1) 他不愿受束缚，所以不结婚。(2) 要想外出度假时，宠物会成为牵累。(3) 该商行与美国一家公司有关系。(4) 他们想要削弱同英国的关系。(5) 他脱下夹克,松开领带。(6) 他身穿淡蓝色的衬衣,系了一条与衬衣相配的领带。(7) 门后有封塑料袋用的捆紮条.(8) 每个队都有两次得分，比赛不分胜负。(9) 今天早上我笨手笨脚的,连鞋带都系不好了。(10) 飞机将要起来,请系好安全带。(11) 我们必须使他受合同约束。(12) 我需要一根铁丝或绳子来捆它。(13) 这腰带是在前面打结还是在後面？(14) 这女孩把线的两端结起来。
[sound:youdao-a8482e06-1817560d-0c132e74-c6b26da1-301edeb9.mp3]

translation:
n. 老虎; 各种猫科动物; 凶恶的人，虎狼之徒

分布：老虎(99%)，凶残之人(1%)


→来自拉丁语 tigris,老虎，来自希腊语 tigris,老虎，其原义为箭，因老虎捕食猎物时箭一般的 速度而得名，该希腊词借自波斯某语言，如古波斯语 tigri,箭，伊拉克巴比伦文明两河流域 发源地其中之一 Tigris River,底格里斯河，字面意思为像箭一样湍急的水流，最终来自 steig,尖刺，刺穿，词源同 stick.

n. 老虎；凶暴的人
 - dragon
examples: 英 ['taɪɡə(r)] 美 ['taɪɡər]

(1) The tiger is a representative of the cat family.(2) The hunter hurled his spear at the tiger.(3) The tiger dragged its kill into the jungle.(4) He moved like a tiger stalking its prey.(5) The number of tigers has reduced abruptly in the last fifty years.(6) He's a tiger on the tennis court.
(1) 老虎是猫科动物的典型。(2) 猎人用力把他的长矛向虎投去。(3) 这只老虎拖着它的猎物进了丛林。(4) 他像老虎一样悄悄潜近他的猎物。(5) 在过去的五十年里，老虎的数目锐减。(6) 他在网球场上是一个凶暴的人。

translation:
adj. 紧的，牢固的; 绷紧的; 不漏的; 密集的，紧凑的
adv. 紧紧地; 牢固地

级别：tighter, tightest
分布：紧的(47%)，紧紧地(23%)，紧身的(12%)，牢固地(9%)，密集的(5%)，迅速地(3%)，拮据的(1%)


→来自中古英语 thight,拉紧的，来自 Proto-Germanic*thinhtaz,拉紧的，来自 tenkt,紧的，厚 的，来自 ten,伸长，拉紧，词源同 tenure,tense.-ght,过去分词格，词源同 bright,caught. 引申诸相关词义。
a.紧的;紧身的,装紧的;密封的ad.紧紧地Money will be tight overnight after tonight's midnight.银根将在今晚午夜之后一下紧缩.



adjective adverb  ESSENTIAL  ■(held or kept together) firmly or closely 紧的；密封的（地）；牢固的（地）
•I can't untie the knot - it's too tight.我解不开这个结——太紧了。

•This lid is on very tight.这盖子盖得很紧。

•The people stood talking in tight groups.大家一群群地紧挨着站在那里说话。

•Hold on tight when we go round this corner.我们转弯时大家都要抓牢扶好。

•Check that windows and doors are shut tight (= completely closed) before you leave.走之前检查一下窗户和门是否关严了。

•The plastic cover was stretched tight (= stretched as much as it could be) across the tank.水箱上的塑胶罩子绷得很紧。
⇒ See also airtight;watertight
[taɪt] adjective UNCOMFORTABLE  不舒适的  ■Clothes or shoes that are tight fit the body too closely and are uncomfortable （衣服或鞋子）紧的，小的
•That jacket's too tight - you want a bigger size.那件夹克太紧身——你需要大号一点的。
■If you have a tight feeling in your chest you have an uncomfortable feeling of pressure, caused by illness, fear, etc. （由于疾病、恐惧等）憋闷的，不适的
[taɪt] adjective LIMITING  限制  ■Controls or rules that are tight are ones which severely limit what can happen （管制措施或规则）严格的
•tight security严密的安全措施

[taɪt] adjective NOT MUCH  不多  ■If time or money is tight, there is only just enough of it （时间、金钱）紧的，拮据的
•I'm sorry I can't stop, time's really tight.对不起我不能停，时间真的很紧。

•They're raising three kids on one small salary so money is very tight.他们靠一份微薄薪水抚养三个孩子，所以手头很紧。

[taɪt] adjective NOT GENEROUS  吝啬的  ■informal disapprovingtight-fisted  （不表赞同的不正式用法）吝啬的；小气的
[taɪt] adjective DRUNK  醉的  old-fashioned informal ■having had too much alcohol; drunk 饮酒过多的；醉的
•Jim, you're tight!吉姆，你醉了！

[taɪt] adjective RELATIONSHIP  关系  informal ■If you are tight with someone, you know them very well and like them a lot 亲密的；个人关系密切的（如果你和某人个人关系密切，则你非常了解他且很喜欢他）
•We're tight - we've been best friends since we were at school.我们的关系很密切－－自同窗时就是最要好的朋友。

[taɪt] adjective be in a tight corner/spot ■to be in a difficult situation 被逼到角落里；身处困境



adj. [服装]  [贸易] 紧的； [机] 密封的；绷紧的；麻烦的；严厉的；没空的；吝啬的
 - severe, hard, fast, sealed, rigorous
adv. 紧紧地；彻底地
 - thoroughly, entirely, completely, fully, fast
examples: 英 [taɪt] 美 [taɪt]
adj.紧的；紧身的；密集的；拮据的adv.紧紧地；牢固地；迅速地

(1) This pair of trousers is too tight for me.(2) This drawer is too tight for me to open it.(3) That fat woman looked ridiculous in her tight golden dress.(4) Don't they know how tight my schedule is?(5) Since money was tight, we settled for a short trip to the south.(6) She held her baby tight in her arms.(7) With a bread knife Miss Martha quickly made a deep slash in each of the stale loaves, inserted a generous quantity of butter, and pressed the loaves tight again.(8) If markets suddenly become more volatile, hedge funds can very quickly unwind their short yen positions, whereas households are more likely to sit tight.

(1) 这条裤子我穿太紧了。(2) 这抽屉太紧了，我打不开。(3) 那位胖妇人穿着金色的紧身礼服，显得滑稽可笑。(4) 他们不晓得我的日程安排有多紧吗?(5) 既然钱紧了一点,我们退而求其次,来一趟短期的南部之旅。(6) 她紧紧地搂着她的孩子。(7) 玛莎小姐迅速地在两条面包上分别深深地切了一刀，慷慨地加进了好多黄油，然后再把面包压实。(8) 若市场波动水平突然增大，对冲基金能够迅速地对日元空头头寸进行平仓，然而家庭投资者则倾向于采取观望态度。
[sound:youdao-23938bdc-951c1e9c-05a3bc0e-2130dfa0-e7ec5c6b.mp3]

translation:
conj. 直到…时（为止）; 在…之前
vt. 耕种; 耕作
n. 钱柜，钱箱; 放钱的抽屉; [地]冰碛土（物）
prep. 直到

时态：tilled, tilling, tills
分布：耕作(33%)，放钱的抽屉(28%)，备用现金(25%)，直到 ... 为止(14%)


→来自古英语 til,朝向，直到，来自 Proto-Germanic*til,朝向，直到，来自 Proto-Germanic*tilan, 努力，终点，目标，可能来自 do,表方向，朝向，词源同 to.
prep.直到,直到...为止,与until意思相同He didn't return home till five.他直到五时才回家.



preposition conjunction  IMPROVER  ■up to (the time that); until 直到；到…为止
•We waited till half past six for you.我们一直等你到六点半。

•Up till 1918, women in Britain were not allowed to vote.在1918年以前，英国不允许妇女参加选举。

•How long is it till your baby is due?你还有多久生孩子？

[tɪl] noun countable mainly UK (US usually register) ■the drawer in a cash register (= a machine which records sales in a shop, and in which money is kept) or the  cash register itself 收银机的抽屉；收银机
•Next time you have the till open, could you give me some change?下次打开收银机时，你给我些零钱好吗？

•I think these items have been rung up wrongly on the till.我想这些商品在收银机上记错了。

[tɪl] verb transitive ■to prepare and use land for growing crops 耕，犁（土地）
•This piece of land has been tilled for hundreds of years.这块土地已经被耕耘了几百年。




n. [地理]  [水文] 冰碛；放钱的抽屉； [会计] 备用现金
 - glacial drift
prep. 直到
 - unto, hasta
vt. 耕种；犁
 - farm, plant crops
vi. 耕种；耕耘
 - plant crops
examples: 英 [tɪl] 美 [tɪl]
prep.直到 ... 为止conj.直到 ... 为止n.放钱的抽屉；备用现金；[地质]冰碛土(物)v.耕作

(1) The meeting adjourned till five o'clock.(2) Never put off till tomorrow what you can do today.(3) Not till then did I realize the danger of the situation.(4) Gee, I can hardly wait till it's dark.(5) We must stick to our task till it is finished.(6) People do not know the value of health till they lose it.
(1) 会议延至五点召开。(2) 今日事今日毕。(3) 直到那个时候我才感到形势的危险。(4) 哎呀，我简直等不到天黑了。(5) 我们必须继续工作，直至做好为止。(6) 直到失去健康，人们才知道健康的可贵。
[sound:youdao-df3daf62-9747c544-ad9343a7-4ebe86a5-9efe9be0.mp3]

translation:
n. 木材，木料; （用于建筑或制作物品的）树木; 用材林，林场; 素质
vt. 用木料支撑; 备以木材

分布：木材(88%)，木料(12%)


→来自古英语 timber,房屋，建筑物，来自 Proto-Germanic*timran,建筑物，来自 deme,建造， 修建，来自 dom,屋子，住所，词源同 dome,domicile.后引申词义建筑材料，树木，木材， 木料等。
n.木材,木料We must safeguard forest timber.我们必须保护森林.
【记】源于：lumber（n 木材）【区】timbre（n 音色；音质）



US [-bɚ] noun  ADVANCED  uncountable ■trees that are grown so that the wood from them can be used for building 林木；树木
•a timber forest材用林

•These trees are being grown for timber.这些树是供材用而栽种的。
 ADVANCED  uncountable UK (US lumber) ■wood used for building 木材
•a timber merchant木材商
 ADVANCED  countable ■a long piece of wood used for building, especially houses and ships 木料
•roof timbers房檩

•a timber-framed building木结构房屋

UK ['tɪm.bər] US [-bɚ] exclamation ■shouted when a tree which has been cut is about to fall （在被伐树木倒下前喊的）倒啦




timber, wood, lumber, log

这组词都有“木材”的意思，其区别是：
timber: 指经过匠人初步加要的备用木材，多用于英国英语。
wood: 最普通用词，含义广，除表示“木材，木”外，还可用复数形式表示森林。
lumber: 指伐下后未经削磨的木材，现多用于美国英语中。
log: 指原木或圆木。


n. [木] 木材；木料
 - wood, tree
examples: 英 ['tɪmbə(r)] 美 ['tɪmbər]
n.木材；木料

(1) He used to be a timber merchant.(2) Seasoned timber does not warp.(3) The farmer spent a day in the woods hewing timber.(4) We are making a bed from scrap timber.(5) He squared off the log to make a timber.(6) The timber will be tailed in the wall.
(1) 他曾是一个木材商。(2) 经干燥处理的木材不会翘曲。(3) 这个农夫花了一天时间在森林里砍木材。(4) 我们在用碎木料做一张床。(5) 他把那块圆木削成了方形木料。(6) 木料的一端将被嵌进墙壁。
[sound:youdao-dded0e9b-38e82bab-4edddcad-2112a23e-f09154ed.mp3]

translation:
n. 交通工具的运行时间表，时刻表; 计划; 课程表; 进度
vi. 为…安排时间

分布：时间表(78%)，时刻表(16%)，课程表(6%)


UK (US schedule) noun countable  ADVANCED  ■a list of the times when events are planned to happen, especially the times when buses, trains and planes leave and arrive （尤指公共汽车、火车和飞机的）起讫时刻表；时间表
•Do you have a Birmingham to London train timetable that I could borrow?你有从伯明罕到伦敦的列车时间表借我一用吗？

•The timetable for our trip to Paris includes visits to Notre Dame, the Eiffel Tower and the Louvre.我们巴黎之行的时间表上包括参观巴黎圣母院、埃菲尔铁塔和罗浮宫。

•Here is the timetable of events for the day.这是一天的排程表。

•I've got a very busy timetable next week (= I have a lot of activities planned).下周我的时间表排得满满的。
 ADVANCED  ■a list of the times when classes in school happen （学校的）课程表
•The first lesson on the timetable for Monday morning is history.课程表上周一上午的第一节课是历史。

['taɪmˌteɪ.bl] UK (US schedule) verb transitive usually passive ■to plan when something is going to happen 为…安排时间
•[+ to infinitive] We are timetabled to go to the British Museum on Thursday and the Tower of London on Friday.根据时间表的安排，我们周四去大英博物馆，周五去伦敦塔。

•The lecture is timetabled for 5.00 p.m.根据时间表的安排，讲座在下午五点开始。




n. [交] 时间表； [铁路] 时刻表；课程表
 - kalendar, milestones
examples: 英 ['taɪmteɪbl] 美 ['taɪmteɪbl]
n.时间表；时刻表；课程表

(1) I'll change my timetable to fay in with yours.(2) There have been a few alterations to the timetable.(3) The timetable is subject to change without notice.(4) The new timetable will come into effect next month.(5) According to the school timetable, Xiaoming and his classmates will have more courses next semester.
(1) 我将改变时间表以便和你们的吻合起来。(2) 时间表上有一些变动。(3) 本时刻表随时可能改变，不另行通知。(4) 新的火车时刻表下个月生效。(5) 从课程表看，小明他们下个学期的课程比这个学期还要多。

translation:
adj. 胆小的; 羞怯的; 怕人; 羞手羞脚

→来自拉丁语 timere,使恐惧，可能来自 teme,黑暗的，词源同 temerity,tenebrous.
胆怯的[tim=fear,表示"害怕"]
a.胆怯的,怯懦的He is timid of action.他战战兢兢地行动.
【记】tim胆小，id：胆小的。参：timorous（adj 胆子小的）【反】audacious（adj 大胆的；卤莽的）



adjective ■shy and nervous; without much confidence; easily frightened 羞怯的；胆小的，胆怯的
•Lucy is a rather timid child.露西是个非常羞怯的孩子。

•My horse is a bit timid and is easily frightened by traffic.我的马有点胆小，容易受到来往车辆的惊吓。

 - modest, harehearted

adj.胆怯的；害羞的

(1) They taunted him for being timid.(2) The least noise would startle the timid child.(3) He is a timid boy; it's impossible for him to brawl with anyone.(4) She was too timid to talk with other travelers.(5) She is a timid cat.(6) I wanted to take him fishing but I was too timid to ask him.

translation:
n. 锡; 罐头盒; 马口铁; 镀锡薄钢板

→来自古英语 tin,锡，来自 Proto-Germanic*tinom,锡。

noun METAL  金属   ADVANCED  uncountable ■a silvery-coloured metal, often combined with other metals or used to cover and protect other metals 锡

•piles of soup tins一大堆汤罐头盒

•We used four tins of paint when we painted the ceiling.我们漆天花板用了四桶涂料。

can, tin

tin: 为英国英语。


n. [化学] 锡；罐头，罐； [材] 马口铁

translation:
