vi. 步行; 踩; 踏; 漂泊
vt. 践踏; 踏实; 步行穿过…
n. 流浪汉; 妓女; 游民，流浪汉; 徒步旅行，远足

时态：tramped, tramping, tramps
分布：流浪汉(66%)，践踏(13%)，步行(12%)，徒步(5%)，淫妇(3%)，重脚步声(1%)

[谐音] tramp谐音“穿破～” “流浪汉”天天“步行”，把鞋子都穿破了…… （；￣ェ￣）
→来自低地德语 trampen,踩，踏，跺脚，来自 Proto-Germanic*tremp-,踩，踏，来自 IE*der,步 行，走，跑，词源同 tread,trap.-amp,表音缀，比较 clamp,dump,lump.引申词义流浪汉，流浪 者等。
v.踩,踏,步行,跋涉,重步行走The tramp from the tram swamped the ham hamburger with shampoo.来自有轨电车的流浪者用洗发水淹没火腿汉堡.



noun POOR PERSON  穷人  countable ■a person with no home, job or money who travels around and asks for money from other people 流浪汉；流浪乞丐
[træmp] noun WOMAN  女人  countable US slang disapproving ■a woman who has sex often, with a lot of different partners 荡妇，淫妇
[træmp] noun WALK  走  only singular ■the sound of people all walking together with heavy steps （众人一齐走时发出的）沉重的脚步声
•The streets echoed with the tramp of soldiers' feet.街上回荡着士兵们重重的脚步声。
countable ■a long walk 长途跋涉，长途步行
•The girls went for a tramp through the countryside.女孩去乡间远足。

[træmp] verb intransitive usually + adverb or preposition transitive ■to walk, especially long distances or with heavy steps （尤指长距离地）重步行走，踩，踏
•to tramp through the forest/undergrowth在森林里／灌木丛中跋涉
•We spent a week tramping the streets of Rome, looking for movie locations.我们花了一个星期时间在罗马的街道上四处奔走，寻找拍摄电影的外景地。



vi. 流浪；践踏，踩；脚步沉重地行走
 - step, vagabondize
n. 流浪者；沉重的脚步声；徒步旅行
 - Vagabonds, Nads
vt. 践踏，踩；走过
 - ride down, tread on sth
examples: 英 [træmp] 美 [træmp]
n.徒步；流浪汉；淫妇；重脚步声v.践踏；步行

(1) The boys took a tramp together over the hills.(2) She wants to go for a tramp in the country.(3) The tramp was benumbed by the cold.(4) A tramp came to the door and asked for food.(5) He's a tramp and used to living rough.(6) We heard the tramp of marching soldiers.(7) One must tramp down the earth over sown seed, which is good for the plants.(8) He missed the train,and had to tramp it.(9) He planned to tramp the whole country.
(1) 男孩们一起徒步爬那些山岗。(2) 她想去乡间远足。(3) 那个流浪汉被冻僵了。(4) 一个流浪汉来到门前讨饭吃。(5) 他是流浪汉,惯于风餐雨卧。(6) 我们听见行进中的士兵发出沉重的脚步声。(7) 播种后一定要踩墒，这样有助于植物的生长。(8) 他误了火车，只好步行。(9) 他计划徒步走遍全国。

translation:
vt. 使转移; 使调动; 转让（权利等）; 让与
vi. 转让; 转学; 转乘; 转会（尤指职业足球队）
n. 转移; 调动; 换乘; （运动员）转会

时态：transferred, transferring, transfers
分布：转移(72%)，迁移(14%)，转乘(4%)，调任(3%)，换车(3%)，移动(3%)，汇兑(1%)


→trans-,转移，转变，-fer,带来，词源同 bring,infer.
转送,转移(trans交换+fer→交换带走→转移)[fer=bring,carry,表示"带来,拿来"]
vt./n.转移;转换;转让;过户;迁移;改乘The performer reformed the performance of the transferred transformer.表演者改良了转让的变压器的性能.



US [ˈtræns.fɜ˞ː] (-rr-) ADVANCED  transitive ■to move someone or something from one place, vehicle, person or group to another 搬；转移
•He has been transferred to a psychiatric hospital.他被转到一家精神病医院。

•She transferred her gun from its shoulder holster to her handbag.她把枪从挂肩枪套里转移到手提包里。

•We were transferred from one bus into another.我们被从一辆大客车转到另一辆大客车上。

•Police are investigating how £20 million was illegally transferred from/out of the Trust's bank account.警方正在调查2000万英镑是如何从该基金会的银行帐户上非法转出的。

•The aim is to transfer power/control/responsibility to self-governing regional councils.目的在于把权力／控制权／责任移交给自治的地方议会。

•I'll be upstairs, so could you transfer my phone calls (= arrange that I can receive them) up there, please?我要上楼了，请把我的电话转到楼上好吗？
 ADVANCED  intransitive or transitive [usually + adv/prep] ■to change to a different job, team, place of work, etc., or to make someone do this （使）调动；（使）跳槽；（使）转会
•After a year he transferred to University College, Dublin.一年后，他转到了都柏林大学。

•Some very high-profile British players have transferred to clubs abroad.一些非常有名的英国球员已经转到国外球队。

•He threatened to give up football if his club didn't transfer him (= sell him to another team).他威胁说如果球会不让他转到其他球队，他就不踢足球。
transitive ■to make something the legal property of another person 转让（财产）
•She transferred the house to her daughter before she died.她死前把房子转让给女儿。

verb UK [trænsˈfɜːr] US [ˈtræns.fɜ˞ː] (-rr-)  Common Learner Errors   transferWarning:  Check your verb endings!Many learners make mistakes when using transfer  in the past tense.The past simple and past participle have 'rr'. Don't write 'transfered', write transferred.The -ing  form is transferring.
noun UK [ˈtræns.fɜːr] US [-fɜ˞ː]MOVE/CHANGE  移动／改变   ADVANCED  ■when something or someone moves or is moved from one place, position, etc. to another 转移；转让；调动
•the transfer of information资讯的传递

•Black's transfer to an Italian football club came as a shock to Coventry supporters.布莱克转会到义大利足球会，使考文垂队的球迷大为震惊。

•The official transfer of ownership will take a few days to complete.所有权的正式移交要花几天时间才能办妥。

noun UK [ˈtræns.fɜːr] US [-fɜ˞ː]SPORTS  运动  countable ■a player who has moved from one sports team to another 转会的球员
•They've a new transfer from Tottenham playing for them.他们有一个从托特纳姆队转会来为他们效力的新球员。

noun UK [ˈtræns.fɜːr] US [-fɜ˞ː]TRAVEL TICKET  车票  countable US ■a ticket which allows a passenger to change routes or to change from one bus or train to another 转车票，换乘票
noun UK [ˈtræns.fɜːr] US [-fɜ˞ː]PATTERN  图案  countable ■a picture or pattern which can be fixed to a surface by pressing it against the surface and then rubbing or heating it （透过压擦或加热转印到物体表面的）转印图画，转印图案
•The kids bought transfers and ironed them onto their T-shirts.孩子们买来转印图画，然后用熨斗印到他们的短袖圆领运动衫。
 Compare decal




transmit, transfer, transcend, transport, translate

transmit: 发射，播送；传播，传染；留传，遗传；
transfer: 转移，迁移；
transcend: 超过，翻越；
transport: 运输，运送，输送；
translate: 翻译；说明，使变成



transfer, remove, shift, move

这组词都有“从一处移往另一处”的意思，其区别是：
transfer: 一般表示转送或移交迁移，尤指交通运输中的换乘或职务的调动等。
remove: 作“移动”解时，与move可换用，还可指撤职或开除学藉等。
shift: 侧重位置与方向的改变。
move: 普通用词，指从一处到另一外的任何距离的转移。



transfer, transaction, transition, transmission, transformation

这是一组在考研和CET-6中经常出现的形近易混词。
transfer: n.转移，转让；(工作的)调动；(旅途中的)换乘，改变路线。
 • The club's goalkeeper isn't happy here, and has asked a transfer.   这个足球俱乐部的守门员在此过得不愉快，已经要求转会到其他俱乐部。
transaction: n.交易行为，处理。
 • Transactions of shares on the stock exchange were up today.   今天证券交易所的股票成交额上升了。
transition: n. (从一种情况到另一种的)过渡，更替。
 • The transition from high school to college can be difficult for students.   对于学生来说，从中学到大学的过渡会是困难的。
transmission: n.传播(比如疾病)；广播。
 • The transmission of germs can occur by contact, breathing, and eating.   细菌通过接触、呼吸和饮食传播。
transformation: n. (外观或性质的)改变，改观，转变。
 • His character seems to have undergone a complete transformation since his marrige.   他结婚之后性格判若两人。


n. 转让； [计] 转移；传递；过户
 - negotiation, diversion
vi. 转让； [计] 转移；转学；换车
 - make over, dispose of
vt. 转让； [计] 使转移；传递；调任
 - hand, negotiate
examples: 英 [træns'fɜː(r)] 美 [træns'fɜːr]
v.转移；调任；转乘n.迁移；移动；换车；汇兑

(1) The exhibition was transferred to anhtoer city two days later.(2) She has been transferred to another department.(3) I took the subway and then transferred to the bus.(4) His job requires him to accept transfers from a city to another.(5) She got a transfer at the relay station.(6) International trade involves the transfer of currency from one country to another.
(1) 两天后,这个展会转移到另外一个城市。(2) 她已被调往另一个部门。(3) 我搭乘地铁然后再改乘公共汽车。(4) 他的工作要求他在不同的城市间来回奔波。(5) 她在中转站换车了。(6) 国际贸易涉及货币由一国向另一国的汇兑。
[sound:youdao-97b8fe43-7fd3c17a-b83d3fe9-febc1a76-e990f87d.mp3]

translation:
vt. 改变; 改观; 变换
vi. 改变
n. [数]变换式

时态：transformed, transforming, transforms
分布：转换(51%)，改变(48%)，改变；变形；变态(1%)


→trans-,转移，转变，form,形状。
变形;改造(trans变+form→变形)[form=shape,表示"形状"]
vt.改变,变换;变压;转化;改造,改造The performer reformed the performance of the transferred transformer.表演者改良了转让的变压器的性能.



US [-'fɔ:rm] verb transitive  IMPROVER  ■to change completely the appearance or character of something or someone, especially so that they are improved 使彻底改观；使大变样
•The reorganization will transform the British entertainment industry.这次重组将使英国的娱乐业大为改观。

•[R] Whenever a camera was pointed at her, Marilyn would instantly transform herself into a radiant star.每当摄像机对准她的时候，玛丽莲会立刻将自己变成一个耀眼的明星。





turn, transform, change, modify, convert, vary, alter

这组词都有“变化，改变”的意思，其区别是：
turn: 指外形、颜色、气味、性质等方面的变化，比change更通俗。
transform: 指人或物在形状、外观、形式、性质等方面发生的彻底变化，失去原状成为全新的东西。
change: 指任何变化，完全改变，强调与原先的情况有明显的不同。
modify: 强调起限定作用的变化或变更。指细小的变化，常含“缓和、降调”的意味。
convert: 指进行全部或局部改变以适应新的功能或用途。指信仰或态度时，强调较激烈、大的改变。
vary: 暗示不规则或断断续续地变。
alter: 常指轻微的改变，强调基本上保持原物、原状的情况下所进行的部分改变。



transform, rectify, adjust, modify, convert, amend, vary, alter, regulate

这组词都有“调整、改变”的意思，其区别是：
transform: v.指彻底、深远的改变，这种变化完全改变了外观或特性，使被改变的对象脱胎换骨。
 • Remodeling transformed an old, dark house into a cheerful one.   重新装修使这所陈旧昏暗的房子变得赏心悦目。
rectify: v.纠正，校正(错误、文章、合同等)。
 • He rectified the mistake in the contract by changing its wording.   他通过改变措辞纠正了合同里的错误。
adjust: v.一般指很小的改变或技术性的调整；修理。
 • I adjusted the air conditioner to stay cool.   我调节了空调以保持凉爽。
modify: v.改变，修改，以使某物更趋完善，还可以用来表示态度、脾气、意见变得温和。
 • He was loud and angry, and his friends told him to modify his behavior.   他粗声大气，脾气暴躁；朋友们告诉他要改变自己的举止。
convert: v.改变某事物的形式或用途，还可以指改变信仰尤其是宗教信仰。
 • Britain converted to a decimal currency system in 1971.   英国于1971年改用十进制货币体系。
 • He's converted to Catholicism.   他已经皈依天主教。
amend: v. (正式用语)指修改文件、法律、规范等。
 • The politicians amended the law to provide more jobs.   政治家们修正了这项法律以提供更多的就业。
vary: v.强调没有一定规则、陆续的变化或差异。
 • Air fares vary from one airline to another.   航空公司的机票价格各不相同。
alter: v.使事物在外观、性质、用途等方面稍作改变。
 • The tailor altered the waistband on my pants because it was too tight.   裁缝修改了我的裤腰因为它太紧了。
regulate: v.指根据规定或需要对某物(机器、钟表等)进行调整或调节，使之准确工作或运行；多含有"控制"之意。
 • Lights are used to regulate the traffic.   红绿灯被用来管制交通。



invert, transform, revert, convert

这组词都有“转变”的意思，其区别是：
invert: v.使颠倒，使倒转，使反向。常常表示位置、顺序、方向等的颠倒。
 • The baby inverted the cup and spilled her orange juice.   婴儿把杯子打翻，弄洒了里面的橙汁。
transform: v.改变，转变，指形状、颜色、大小、性质等的改变。
 • A little paint will soon transform the old house.   刷一点油漆很快就会使这所旧房子大为改观。
revert: v.归还，恢复原状。指回到原来的状态或情形。
 • John gave his brother a house, and when his brother died, ownership reverted back to John.   约翰送给他的哥哥一所房子，当他的哥哥去世后，房子的所有权重新归于约翰。
convert: v.转变，变换，含有"使某人改变观点"的意思。
 • He wants to convert to Catholicism.   他要皈依天主教。


vt. 改变，使…变形；转换
 - influence, fashion, vary, innovate
vi. [数]  [电] 变换，改变；转化
 - veer from, to change
examples: 英 [træns'fɔːm] 美 [træns'fɔːm]
vt.改变；转换vi.改变；变形；变态

(1) She is responsible for the character part of the hero's devoted mother.(2) The magician transformed the frog into a princess.(3) His plans were transformed overnight into reality.(4) We should try to transform heat into power.(5) I believe she would transform me into a talker.
(1) 她负责这个主人公的忠诚的母亲的角色部分。(2) 魔术师把青蛙变成了公主。(3) 他的计划迅速变为现实。(4) 我们应该设法将热转化为能量。(5) 我相信，她会把我这个沉默寡言的人变成个碎嘴子。
[sound:youdao-ea9ed820-37ec63f4-12c11bfa-d55afa2c-af3d5c8d.mp3]

translation:
n. 变化; <核>转换; <语>转换; <电>变换

分布：转化(38%)，转型(35%)，改造(27%)


转变,变形(transform+ation)[form=shape,表示"形状"]



US [-fɚ-] noun countable or uncountable  ADVANCED  ■a complete change in the appearance or character of something or someone, especially so that they are improved 彻底改观；大变样
•Local people have mixed feelings about the planned transformation of their town into a regional capital.当地人对于要把他们的小镇变成地区中心城市的计划喜忧参半。

•I'd never seen Carlo in smart evening clothes before - it was quite a transformation.我之前从没见过卡洛穿漂亮的晚装——这可真是个天大的变化。





transfer, transaction, transition, transmission, transformation

这是一组在考研和CET-6中经常出现的形近易混词。
transfer: n.转移，转让；(工作的)调动；(旅途中的)换乘，改变路线。
 • The club's goalkeeper isn't happy here, and has asked a transfer.   这个足球俱乐部的守门员在此过得不愉快，已经要求转会到其他俱乐部。
transaction: n.交易行为，处理。
 • Transactions of shares on the stock exchange were up today.   今天证券交易所的股票成交额上升了。
transition: n. (从一种情况到另一种的)过渡，更替。
 • The transition from high school to college can be difficult for students.   对于学生来说，从中学到大学的过渡会是困难的。
transmission: n.传播(比如疾病)；广播。
 • The transmission of germs can occur by contact, breathing, and eating.   细菌通过接触、呼吸和饮食传播。
transformation: n. (外观或性质的)改变，改观，转变。
 • His character seems to have undergone a complete transformation since his marrige.   他结婚之后性格判若两人。


n. [遗] 转化；转换；改革；变形
 - conversion, deformation, reform, distortion, switching
examples: 英 [ˌtrænsfə'meɪʃn] 美 [ˌtrænsfər'meɪʃn]
n.转型；转化；改造

(1) The foundation is about to go through another transformation.(2) The subway is part of Beijing's transformation to a more urbane metropolis.(3) His character seems to have undergone a complete transformation since his marriage.(4) The transformation of that project has been finished.(5) The transformation of traditional industries was accelerated.(6) We have chosen the peaceful transformation of capitalist industry and commerce.
(1) 基金会正准备进行另一次转型。(2) 地铁是北京向一个更为现代的大都市转型的一部分。(3) 他结婚之后性格判若两人。(4) 那个项目的改造已经完成。(5) 传统工业加快了改造步伐。(6) 我们对资本主义工商业采用了和平改造的办法。

translation:

→来自 transform,转变，-er,表物。引申词义变压器。



US [-'fɔ:r.mɚ] specialized noun countable ■a device which changes the voltage or other characteristic of electrical energy as it moves from one circuit to another 变压器
•You may need a transformer if you want to run a personal stereo off mains electricity.如果想透过输电干线供电给个人立体音响，你可能需要一个变压器。




n. [电] 变压器；促使变化的人

translation:

分布：晶体管(90%)，晶体管收音机(10%)


→合成自 transfer,转移，resistor,电阻器。因该电子元件通过电阻器转移电流而得名。
n.晶体管;晶体管收音机My sister insists consistently on persistent resistance to transistor radios.妹妹一贯坚决主张持久抵制晶体管收音机.



US [-'zɪs.tɚ] noun countable ■a small electrical device containing a semiconductor , used in televisions, radios, etc. to control or increase an electric current 晶体管，电晶体(also transistor radio) (informal trannie) ■a small radio containing transistors, used especially in the past （尤指旧时的）电晶体收音机

translation:
vt. & vi. 翻译; 解释; 转化; 被翻译

时态：translated, translating, translates
分布：翻译(89%)，解释(7%)，转移(2%)，调动(2%)


→来自拉丁语 translatus,转变的，转移的，来自 trans-,转移，转变，latus,携带的，承担的，来 自*tlatus,来自 tel,支撑，承载，词源同 relate,extol,tolerate.该拉丁词 latus 用作另一个拉丁 词 ferre 的过去分词形式，因而词根-lat 为-fer 过去分词形式。引申词义翻译，转变等。
翻译;转化(trans交换+late→交换拿出→翻译)[lat=bring,out,表示"拿出,带出"]
v.翻译,解释;转化,One of my relatives, a late translator, translated a book relating to public relations.我的一位亲戚,一个已故翻译,翻译了一本有关公共关系的书.



verb intransitive or transitive  IMPROVER  ■to change words into a different language 译，翻译
•We were asked to translate a list of sentences.我们被要求翻译一组句子。

•She works for the EU, translating from English into French.她在欧盟工作，担任英译法翻译。
 Compare interpret  to change something into a new form, especially to turn a plan into reality 转化（尤指将计划变为现实）
•So how does this theory translate into practical policy?那么如何将这个理论应用于制定现实可行的政策呢？

•The ways of working that he had learnt at college did not translate well (= were not suitable) to the world of business.他在大学里学到的工作方式并不适合商业世界。
translate sth as sth ■to decide that words, behaviour or actions mean a particular thing 认为…意味着…
•He mumbled something which I translated as agreement.他嘴里咕哝了句甚么，我想是表示同意。





transmit, transfer, transcend, transport, translate

transmit: 发射，播送；传播，传染；留传，遗传；
transfer: 转移，迁移；
transcend: 超过，翻越；
transport: 运输，运送，输送；
translate: 翻译；说明，使变成


vt. 翻译；转化；解释；转变为；调动
 - remove, expound
vi. 翻译
 - interpret
examples: 英 [træns'leɪt] 美 [træns'leɪt]
v.翻译；解释；转移；调动

(1) I need to translate it into English.(2) Be you plan to translate the novel?(3) I translate his silence as a protest.(4) It is hard to translate the animal's behaviour .(5) We should translate the schemes into actions.(6) He was translated to the Ministry of Defence.
(1) 我必须把它译成英语。(2) 你计划翻译这部小说吗？(3) 我把他的沉默解释为抗议。(4) 那种动物的行为很难解释。(5) 我们应该把计划变成行动。(6) 他被调到国防部工作。

translation:
n. 翻译; 译本; 转变; 转化

分布：翻译(86%)，译文(11%)，平移(3%)


→translate,翻译，转变，-ion,名词后缀。
n.翻译;译文,译本Chapman's translation of Homer.查普曼的荷马史诗译本.



noun countable or uncountable  ADVANCED  ■something which is translated, or the process of translating something, from one language to another 翻译（从一种语言翻译成另一种语言的内容，或将某种内容从一种语言翻译成另一种语言的过程）
•The children do one French translation a week.孩子们每周做一次法语翻译。

•A literal translation of 'euthanasia' would be 'good death'.euthanasia 这个词从字面上翻译就是“安乐死”。

•The English version is boring - perhaps it has lost something in translation (= is not as good as the original).英语版读起来枯燥乏味——也许翻译得有点走味。
in translation ■changed into someone's own language, not in the original language 翻译过来的
•She reads Proust in translation.她读的是普鲁斯特作品的译本。





translation, interpretation

translation: 翻译，转换
interpretation: 口译，解释



translation, paraphrase, version

这组词都有“翻译，译文”的意思，其区别是：
translation: 普通用词，指从一种语言到另一种语言的翻译。
paraphrase: 可指非常自由的解释，不拘泥遣词造句，重在传意。通常指用同样语言深入浅出地解释艰深的句子或段落。
version: 可与translation换用，尤指不拘泥于文字的意译，更常指某种作品的一种译文。


n. [语]  [计] 翻译；译文；转化；调任
 - interpretation, version
examples: 英 [træns'leɪʃn] 美 [træns'leɪʃn]
n.翻译；译文；RNA的转录；平移

(1) I am making a verbal translation.(2) The effect of the novel loses in translation.(3) I think her translation of the article is much better than his.(4) Invariance under translation in time leads to conservation of energy.
(1) 我正在逐字的翻译。(2) 这部小说经过翻译失色不少。(3) 我认为她对这篇文章的翻译要比他强的多。(4) 在时间平移下的不变性导致能量守恒。
[sound:youdao-bcb192da-79ce9141-32943934-78c4bbde-a70ef446.mp3]

translation:
n. 播送; 传送; （电台或电视）信息; 传动装置

分布：传输(61%)，传播(27%)，变速器(8%)，播送(4%)


→transmit,传送，发射，-ss,过去分词格，-ion,名词后缀。
转送;传达(trans横＋miss+ion→横着送→传送过去)[Miss,mit=send,cast,表示"送,放出"]
n.播送,发射;传动,传送The influenza virus has shown person-to-person transmission in a given locale.业已证明流行性感冒病毒能在特定地点在人与人之间传播.



US [træns-] noun RADIO/TELEVISION  广播／电视   ADVANCED  countable or uncountable ■the process of broadcasting something by radio, television, etc., or something which is broadcast （广播、电视等的）播送，播送内容
•We apologize for the interruption to our transmissions this afternoon.我们为今天下午广播节目的中断表示歉意。

UK [trænz'mɪʃ.ən] US [træns-] noun PASSING  传递  uncountable ■the process of passing something from one person or place to another 传递；传播
•the transmission of disease疾病的传播

UK [trænz'mɪʃ.ən] US [træns-] noun VEHICLE  车辆  countable or uncountable ■the machinery that brings the power produced by the engine to the wheels of a vehicle 传动装置
•automatic transmission自动传动装置

•The car had a faulty transmission.这辆汽车的传动装置出现故障。





transfer, transaction, transition, transmission, transformation

这是一组在考研和CET-6中经常出现的形近易混词。
transfer: n.转移，转让；(工作的)调动；(旅途中的)换乘，改变路线。
 • The club's goalkeeper isn't happy here, and has asked a transfer.   这个足球俱乐部的守门员在此过得不愉快，已经要求转会到其他俱乐部。
transaction: n.交易行为，处理。
 • Transactions of shares on the stock exchange were up today.   今天证券交易所的股票成交额上升了。
transition: n. (从一种情况到另一种的)过渡，更替。
 • The transition from high school to college can be difficult for students.   对于学生来说，从中学到大学的过渡会是困难的。
transmission: n.传播(比如疾病)；广播。
 • The transmission of germs can occur by contact, breathing, and eating.   细菌通过接触、呼吸和饮食传播。
transformation: n. (外观或性质的)改变，改观，转变。
 • His character seems to have undergone a complete transformation since his marrige.   他结婚之后性格判若两人。


n. 传动装置， [机] 变速器；传递； [计]  [通信] 传送；播送
 - gear, driving device
examples: 英 [træns'mɪʃn] 美 [træns'mɪʃn]
n.传输；传播；播送；变速器

(1) He varied the transmission frequency.(2) Animals may serve as a vehicle for viral transmission.(3) We now interrupt our normal transmissions to bring you a special news flash.(4) The company has a transmission plant in France.(5) A 4-speed automatic transmission is optional.
(1) 他变换了无线电传送的频率。(2) 动物可能成为病毒传播的媒介。(3) 我们现中断正常节目，播送一条特别新闻。(4) 那家公司在法国有一座变速器工厂。(5) 四段自动变速器是可自由选择的。
[sound:youdao-4842750a-eb92e1e3-85ec10cf-3f3ee12a-48ec631e.mp3]

translation:
vt. 传输; 传送，传递; 发射; 传染
vi. 发送信号

时态：transmitted, transmitting, transmits
分布：传送(67%)，传染(18%)，传达(14%)，代代相传(1%)


→trans-,转移，-mit,送出，词源同 emit,mission.
传送,传播(trans+mit送→横着送消息→传播)[trans-①表示"横过,越过"②表示"变换,改变,转移"]
寄送;传达(trans横＋mit→横送过去→传达)[Miss,mit=send,cast,表示"送,放出"]
vt.传输/导;转送;发射vi.发射信号;发报The missionary transmitted emission emitted lately.传教士传播了新近散发出来的散发物.



US [træns-] (-tt-)verb RADIO/TELEVISION  广播／电视   ADVANCED  intransitive or transitive ■to broadcast something, or to send out or carry signals using radio, television, etc. 播送，发射，传送（信号）
•Radio Seven transmits on 201 medium wave (= uses those particular radio waves to broadcast on).广播七台透过中波201千赫广播。

•The information is transmitted electronically to the central computer.这些资讯以电子化的方式传送到中央电脑。

UK [trænz'mɪt] US [træns-] (-tt-)verb PASS  传递   ADVANCED  transitive ■to pass something from one person or place to another 传递；传播
•a sexually transmitted disease性传播疾病

•Cholera is transmitted through contaminated water.霍乱是透过受污染的水传播。

•Some diseases are transmitted from one generation to the next.有些疾病是世代遗传的。

•[R] Somehow your panic and fear transmits itself to the horse that you're riding.不知怎么的，你的恐惧会传染给你骑的马。





transmit, send, forward, deliver, ship, dispatch

这组词都有“送出，发送，传送”的意思，其区别是：
transmit: 指将文件、消息等的内容或类似的东西发至某地或传达给他人。
send: 普通最常用词，含义广。指把人或物由一地送往另一地，而不涉及事物的内容或 送的方式。
forward: 指经过其他人或手段把东西转送给某人。
deliver: 指把信件、包裹等物寄发出去或交到某地，或直接交与某人，着重发送这一行为。
ship: 把通过水运、陆运或空运等方式运送东西。现常指商业上的运货，或将物品托运。
dispatch: 指为特殊目的而发送或派遣，强调紧急或快速。



transmit, transfer, transcend, transport, translate

transmit: 发射，播送；传播，传染；留传，遗传；
transfer: 转移，迁移；
transcend: 超过，翻越；
transport: 运输，运送，输送；
translate: 翻译；说明，使变成


vt. 传输；传播；发射；传达；遗传
 - release, send, communicate, project, let go
examples: 英 [træns'mɪt] 美 [træns'mɪt]
vt.传达；传染；传送；代代相传vi.(以无线电或有线电的方式)发送信号

(1) Gypsies frequently transmit recipes orally within the family.(2) Please transmit my best regards to your lovely wife.(3) This infection is transmitted by mosquitoes.(4) The tension soon transmitted itself to all the members of the crowd.(5) I will transmit the money by special messenger.(6) This photo is too large to transmit at one time.(7) The World Cup final is being transmitted live to over fifty countries.(8) Parents transmit some of their characteristics to their children.
(1) 吉普赛人经常以口头形式把秘方世代相传。(2) 请转达我向您娇妻的致意。(3) 这种传染病是由蚊子传染的。(4) 这种紧张情绪很快感染了人群中所有的人。(5) 我将专门派人送这笔钱。(6) 这相片太大，一次没法发出。(7) 世界杯决赛现在正向五十多个国家现场转播。(8) 父母把某些特性遗传给子女。
[sound:youdao-c1893d51-3dd2b0ee-d8c4ea2a-7955fc15-6196a447.mp3]

translation:
adj. 透明的; 清澈的; 易识破的; 显而易见的

分布：透明的(94%)，明显的(4%)，清晰的(2%)


→trans-,进入，穿过，-par,发光，透明，词源同 appear,apparent.
透明的(trans+par平等＋ent→横穿过去看得一样清楚→透明的)[trans-①表示"横过,越过"②表示"变换,改变,转移"]
透明的;明白的(trans穿过+par+ent→穿过去能看见→透明的)[par,pear=comeinsight,表示"看见"]
a.透明的,透光的;易理解的;明显的His parents apparently stare at the transparent cigarettes.他父母显然凝视着透明香烟.
【记】trans穿过，parent－光线可以穿过－透明的【反】opaque（adj 不透明的）；deceitful（adj 欺诈的）；delusive（adj 欺骗的）



US [træn'sper-] adjective  ADVANCED  ■If a substance or object is transparent, you can see through it very clearly 透明的
•Grow the bulbs in a transparent plastic box, so the children can see the roots growing.把球茎种在透明的塑胶盒里，这样孩子就能看到根的生长。

•Her blouse was practically transparent!她的衬衫几乎是透明的！
 Compare opaque ; translucent  clear and easy to understand or recognize 清楚易懂的；显而易见的
•I think we should try to make the instructions more transparent.我觉得我们应该尽可能使这些指示更清楚易懂些。





clear, transparent

这组词都有“透明的”的意思，其区别是：
clear: 指视力不受阻碍，强调清晰透澈。
transparent: 指某物完全透明状态，通过它能清楚看到其它东西。


adj. 透明的；显然的；坦率的；易懂的
 - apparent, honest, decided, crystal, open
examples: 英 [træns'pærənt] 美 [træns'pærənt]
adj.透明的；明显的；清晰的

(1) Plain glass is transparent.(2) The insect's wings are almost transparent.(3) It was transparent that her pride was hurt.(4) Your words are a transparent lie.(5) I like her transparent style of writing.(6) The meaning of this passage seems quite transparent.
(1) 普通的白玻璃是透明的。(2) 这昆虫的翅膀几乎是透明的。(3) 很显然，她的自尊心受到了伤害。(4) 你所说的明显是谎言。(5) 我喜欢她明晰的文体。(6) 这一段的意思看来是相当清楚的。
[sound:youdao-382ed7ce-6d14b0f4-686e9854-081733cd-34de264b.mp3]

translation:
vt. 运送，运输; 流放; 使欣喜若狂
n. 运输; 运输船（机），运输系统; 狂喜; 流放犯

时态：transported, transporting, transports
分布：运输(95%)，流放(3%)，传播(1%)，激动(1%)


→trans-,转移，-port,携带，词源同 port,report.
运输(trans转移+port→移动着拿→运输)[Port=carry,表示"拿,运"]
v.运输,运送,搬运n.运输;运输系统,运载工具With the reporter's support, the sportsmen are transported to the airport.在记者的支持下,运动员们被运送到了机场.



US [-spɔːrt]GOODS/PEOPLE  货物／人   ESSENTIAL  uncountable ■when people or goods are moved from one place to another 运输，运送，输送
•the transport of live animals活体动物的运输

•The company will arrange transport from the airport.公司将安排从机场起的运输。
 ESSENTIAL  uncountable UK (US transportation) ■a system of vehicles, such as buses, trains, aircraft, etc. for getting from one place to another 交通工具
•the Department of Transport交通部

•investment in public transport (= buses, trains, etc. available for everyone to use)对公共交通的投资

•Do you have your own transport (= vehicle) ?你自己有车吗？

•Bicycles are a cheap and efficient form of transport.脚踏车是一种便宜而高效的交通工具。
  Common Learner Errors   transportTransport   does not have a plural form and cannot be used with a  or an.To talk about transport in general, do not say 'transports', say transport✗ Public transports were not frequent in the evenings.Public transport was not frequent in the evenings.To talk about transport in the singular, do not say 'a transport', say a form/means/mode of transport :✗ The bicycle is a convenient transport.The bicycle is a convenient means of transport.
noun UK [ˈtræn.spɔːt] US [-spɔːrt]FEELING  感觉  in transports (of delight) literary■extremely pleased or happy 欣喜若狂
verb transitive UK [trænˈspɔːt] US [-spɔːrt]GOODS/PEOPLE  货物／人   ADVANCED  ■to take goods or people from one place to another 运输，运送，输送
•The pipeline was constructed to transport oil across Alaska to ports on the coast.建设这条输油管道是为了使石油能够穿越阿拉斯加输送到各沿海港口。

•Such heavy items are expensive to transport (by plane).这样重的物品（用飞机）运输很贵。
■(in the past) to send a criminal to a country far away, to live, as a punishment （旧时）流放，放逐
•162 000 convicts were transported to Australia from 1788 to 1868.从1788年到1868年，有16.2万名犯人被流放到澳大利亚。

verb transitive UK [trænˈspɔːt] US [-spɔːrt]FEELING  感觉  literary■If something transports you to a different time or place, it makes you feel as if you are in it 使产生身临其境的感觉
•The film transported us back to the New York of the 1950s.这部电影将我们带回到20世纪50年代的纽约。





transmit, transfer, transcend, transport, translate

transmit: 发射，播送；传播，传染；留传，遗传；
transfer: 转移，迁移；
transcend: 超过，翻越；
transport: 运输，运送，输送；
translate: 翻译；说明，使变成



convey, fetch, get, transport, take, bring, carry

这组词都有“带、拿、取”的意思，其区别是：
convey: 指通过中间人传递信息，或以某种方式把人或物送到目的地。
fetch: 指一往一返，相当于go and bring，去取了东西或带人再返回到出发处。
get: 口语用词，与fetch基本同义，语气随便。
transport: 指使用车辆或机械设备把人或货物从一处运载到另一处。
take: 指从说话人或说话人心目中所在处把某人或某物带离开，带到离说话者有一定距离的地方，与bring的方向正相反，侧重方向，不着重方式。
bring: 指从某处把人或物带到或拿到说话者所在的地点，强调方向，不着重方式。
carry: 指把物品从一个地方带到另一个地方，不涉及方向，只强调方式。


n. [植] 运输； [航] 运输机；狂喜；流放犯
 - carriage, traffic, conveyance
vt. [植] 运输；流放；使狂喜
 - convey, to freight
examples: 英 ['trænspɔːt] 美 ['trænspɔːrt]
n.运输；心醉v.运输；传播；流放；激动

(1) The goods have been cased up for transport.(2) London Transport run extra trains during the rush-hour.(3) Please find alternative means of transport.(4) The transport of goods by air is very expensive.(5) A helicopter was used to transport the wounded.(6) Wheat is transported from the farms to the mills.(7) Flies transport different kinds of diseases.(8) I was reluctant to let language transport me.
(1) 货物已装箱待运。(2) 伦敦运输公司在交通高峰时 间增开加班列车。(3) 请另外找一个运输方法。(4) 空运货物费用十分昂贵。(5) 一架直升飞机被用来运送伤员。(6) 把小麦从农场运到面粉厂。(7) 苍蝇传播各种不同的疾病。(8) 我不情愿被语言弄得失魂落魄。
[sound:youdao-5370dcd0-3b48125d-960b5cda-9b0b316c-b4a18207.mp3]

translation:
n. 运送，运输; 运输系统; 运输工具; 流放

分布：运输(86%)，运输工具(8%)，运输系统(6%)


→来自 transport,交通，-ion,名词后缀。引申词义交通业。
运输(业)(transport+ation)[Port=carry,表示"拿,运"]
【记】transport（n /v 运输；狂喜），trans转移，port搬运



US [-spɚ-] noun uncountable  IMPROVER  ■when people or goods are moved from one place to another 运输，运送，输送
•In the past, British convicts could be sentenced to transportation (to Australia).过去，英国的犯人可被判处流放（至澳大利亚）。
 IMPROVER  US (UK transport) ■a vehicle or system of vehicles, such as buses, trains, etc. for getting from one place to another 交通工具；车辆
•In Los Angeles many companies encourage their employees to use alternative means of transportation, rather than the car.在洛杉矶，许多公司都鼓励员工不开小汽车，而使用替代交通工具。





traffic, communication, transportation

这组词都有“交通”的意思，其区别是：
traffic: 指来往的东西的情况，表示一种抽象概念的交通流动量。
communication: 指邮电、无线电、铁路、公路等各种交通方式或媒介。
transportation: 指将乘客或货物从一处运到另一处，也可指交通运输工具。


n. [交] 运输；运输系统；运输工具；流放
 - carriage, traffic
examples: 英 [ˌtrænspɔː'teɪʃn] 美 [ˌtrænspɔːr'teɪʃn]
n.运输；运输工具；运输系统

(1) The Panama Canal has played a very important role in transportation.(2) The building of the bridge is very important for the transportation between the two towns.(3) The railroad gives free transportation for a certain amount of baggage.(4) The train is a safe means of transportation.
(1) 巴拿马运河在运输上起到了非常重要的作用。(2) 这座桥的建造对这两个镇的交通很重要。(3) 铁路免费运送的行李是有一定数量的。(4) 火车是一种安全可靠的交通工具。
[sound:youdao-7674ad1e-e455ead5-83124acf-d2814cb7-2c30485d.mp3]

translation:
vt. 诱骗; 使受限制; 困住; 使（水与气体等）分离
n. 圈套; （对付人的）计谋; （练习射击用的）抛靶器; （捕捉动物的）夹子
vi. 设陷阱; 装捕捉机; 设圈套

时态：trapped, trapping, traps
分布：陷阱(70%)，圈套(22%)，困境(4%)，设圈套(3%)，双轮轻便马车(1%)


→来自古英语 traeppe,陷阱，罗网，来自 Proto-Germanic*trep,踩踏，来自 der,走，跑，步 行，词源同 trip,tramp,tread.词义通俗化为圈套。
n.陷阱,圈套vt.诱捕;使中圈套vi.设圈套The mapper trapped in the gap tapped the tap wrapper with strap.陷在缝中的制图者用皮带轻击塞子套.



noun STH THAT PREVENTS ESCAPE  防止逃走的物件   IMPROVER  countable ■a device or hole for catching animals or people and preventing their escape 陷阱；夹子；捕捉器
•The fox got its foot caught in a trap.狐狸的一只脚被夹子夹住了。
 IMPROVER  only singular ■a dangerous or unpleasant situation which you have got into and from which it is difficult or impossible to escape 圈套；诡计
•The undercover agents went to the rendezvous knowing that it might be a trap.尽管知道这可能是个圈套，这些秘密特工还是去了会面地点。

•She's too clever to fall into the trap of doing any unpaid work.她这人很聪明，决不会上当去做任何没有报酬的工作。

[træp] noun MOUTH  嘴  countable slang ■a mouth 嘴
•Oh, shut your trap (= stop talking) - I'm bored of listening to you!哦，闭嘴——我讨厌听你说话！

•I've told him it's a secret and he's to keep  his trap  shut (= not say anything about it).我告诉过他这是个秘密，他得守口如瓶。

[træp] noun VEHICLE  车辆  countable ■a light carriage with two wheels pulled by a horse, used especially in the past （尤指旧时使用的）双轮轻便马车
[træp] verb transitive (-pp-) IMPROVER  ■to catch an animal in a trap 设陷阱（或夹子、捕捉器）捕捉
•She survived in the forest by eating berries and trapping small animals and birds.她靠着吃浆果和设陷阱捕捉小动物和飞鸟，在森林活下来了。
 IMPROVER  ■to keep something such as heat or water in one place, especially because it is useful （尤指为利用而）收集，存住，保存（热量、水等）
•A greenhouse stays warm because the glass traps the heat of the sun.温室保持温暖，因为玻璃吸收了太阳的热量。
be trapped  IMPROVER  ■If someone or something is trapped, they are unable to move or escape from a place or situation 被困住；陷入困境
•The two men died when they were trapped in a burning building.这两名男子因被困在燃烧的大楼里而丧生。

•Fire officers used cutting equipment to free his legs, which were trapped under a steel beam.消防队员们用切割设备松开他被压在一根钢梁下的双腿。

•figurative Jack left the job after ten years because he was beginning to feel trapped.杰克十年后辞掉这份工作，因为他开始感到被束缚住了。
be trapped into (doing) sth ■to be forced or tricked into doing something that you do not want to do 被迫做；被诱骗做
•In his book, Holden speculates that Shakespeare was an unfaithful husband who was trapped into marriage.霍尔登在其书中推测莎士比亚是个被迫结婚而对妻子不忠的丈夫。

•She had been trapped into saying something she did not mean.她被迫说了违心的话。





arrest, seize, catch, capture, trap

这组词都有“抓住，捕捉”的意思，其区别是：
arrest: 指根据法律或命令进行逮捕并予以监禁或拘留。
seize: 侧重指以突然、有力地动作迅速抓住或捉住。
catch: 普通用词，指捉住跑动或隐藏中的人或动物，一般指活捉。
capture: 指通过武力或计谋等，战胜抵抗而捉住敌人或动物。
trap: 多指诱捕。


vt. 诱捕；使…受限制；使…陷入困境
 - ensnare
n. [计] 陷阱；圈套； [建] 存水弯
 - web, mesh, pit
examples: 英 [træp] 美 [træp]
n.圈套；陷阱；困境；双轮轻便马车；U（或S）型管道；防臭瓣v.设圈套；陷入（困境）

(1) The police set a trap to catch the thief.(2) The only thing the wolf could do was climbing up to the ground from the trap.(3) To break out of the poverty trap they need help from the government.(4) By clever questioning they trapped him into making a confession.(5) Some miners were trapped underground after the collapse.
(1) 警察设下了捉拿窃贼的圈套。(2) 那只狼惟一能做的就是从陷阱里爬到地面上来。(3) 为了摆脱贫困的处境，他们需要政府的帮助。(4) 他们用巧妙的提问诱使他招认了。(5) 塌方后，有些矿工被困在地下。

translation:
n. 旅行; 进行; 移动; 漫游
vi. 旅行; 传送; 前进，行进; [篮球]走步
vt. 经过，通过; 游历

时态：travelled, travelling, travels
分布：旅行(89%)，传播(7%)，移动(3%)，快速移动(1%)


→来自中古英语 travailen,远行，出门，原义为折磨，词源同 travail.比喻用法，因古代出门由于 交通不便，出门远行充满艰辛和痛苦。
n.旅行v.旅行;行进,传播On Revenue avenue, the grave traveler jumped the gravestone bravely.在税收大道上,严肃的旅行者勇敢地跳过墓碑.



verb (-ll- or US USUALLY  -l-) ESSENTIAL  intransitive or transitive ■to make a journey, usually over a long distance （通常指长途）旅行
•After leaving school, she spent a year travelling, mostly in Africa and Asia.毕业后她花了一年时间旅行，主要在非洲和亚洲。

•I travel to work by train.我乘火车上班。

•He travelled over 100 miles to be at the wedding.他从100多英里外过来参加婚礼。

•As a young man he had travelled (= been to many parts of) the world.他年轻时周游过世界。
 ESSENTIAL  intransitive ■to move or go from one place to another 行进
•Supersonic planes can travel faster than the speed of sound.超音速飞机的速度比音速快。
intransitive ■If something such as food travels well/badly, it does/does not stay in good condition if it is moved long distances （食品等）经得起长途运输
•They say that real Yorkshire beers don't travel well.他们说真正的约克郡啤酒经不起长途运输。
really travel informal ■to move very fast 飞快移动
•We were doing 90mph, so that other car that passed us must have been really travelling!我们当时的时速是90英里，所以说超过我们的其他车肯定是开得飞快！

•That bike can really travel!那辆脚踏车可以骑得很快！
travel light ■to make a journey without taking a lot of heavy things with you 轻装旅行
•I always try to travel light.我总是尽可能轻装旅行。

['træv.əl] verb (-ll- or US USUALLY  -l-)have sth , will travel humorous ■said if you want to go on a journey and use a particular skill 有…即可旅行，…助你旅行（说的是如果你想去旅行且可利用一种特殊技能）
•The ad in the newspaper read 'Have English language skills, will travel.'报纸上的广告说“踏上英语旅程”。

['træv.əl] verb (-ll- or US USUALLY  -l-)  Common Learner Errors   travelWarning: Check your verb endings!Many learners make mistakes when using travel  in the past tense.The past simple and past participle are trave ll ed in UK English, and, usually, trave l ed   in US English.The -ing form is trave ll ing in UK English, and, usually, trave l ing in US English.
['træv.əl] noun  ESSENTIAL  uncountable ■the activity of travelling 旅行；游历
•air/space travel航空／太空旅行

•business travel出差

•We share a love of literature, food and travel.我们都爱好文学、美食和旅游。

•I heard on the travel news that there'd been an accident.我从旅游新闻中得知发生了一宗事故。
travels [plural] ■journeys 游览；游历
•a record of her travels in/around the Far East她在远东游历的记录

['træv.əl] noun   Common Learner Errors   travel, trip or journey?Warning:  Choose the right word!Travel  is an uncountable noun and refers to the activity of travelling:Air travel has become much cheaper.To talk about a particular occasion where you go somewhere and come back again, don't say 'travel', say trip :✗ I met him on a recent travel to London.I met him on a recent trip to London.To talk about the part of a 'trip' you spend in a vehicle, don't say 'travel', say journey :✗ The travel from the airport takes about 20 minutes.The journey from the airport takes about 20 minutes.




expedition, voyage, journey, trip, travel, excursion, tour, cruise

这组词都有“旅行”的意思，其区别是：
expedition: 指有特定目的远征或探险。
voyage: 指在水上旅行，尤指海上旅行，也可指空中旅行。
journey: 最普通用词，侧重指时间较长、距离较远的单程陆上旅行，也指水上或空中的旅行。
trip: 普通用词，口语多用，常指为公务或游玩作的较短暂的旅行。
travel: 泛指旅行的行为而不指某次具体的旅行，多指到远方作长期旅行，不强调直接目的地，单、复数均可用。
excursion: 较正式用词，常指不超过一天的短时期娱乐性游玩，也可指乘火车或轮船往返特定景点的远足旅游。
tour: 指最后反回出发地，旅途中有停留游览点，距离可长可短，目的各异的周游或巡行。
cruise: 主要指乘船的游览并在多处停靠。


vi. 旅行；行进；步行；交往
 - proceed, foot, company, sort, mix
vt. 经过；在…旅行
 - go by, go past
n. 旅行；游历；漫游
 - journey, tour, trip
examples: 英 ['trævl] 美 ['trævl]
v.旅行；去某地；传播；快速移动；[体]走步n.旅行；移动

(1) I travel 40 miles to work every day.(2) When we speak, sound waves begin to travel in all directions.(3) I don't know the exact speed of the car, but it was certainly travelling.(4) He met many interesting people in his travels.(5) Travel on that road is heavy on holidays.
(1) 我每天奔波40英里去上班。(2) 我们说话时,声波就开始向四面八方传播扩散。(3) 我不知道那辆汽车的准确速度,但它确实开得非常快。(4) 旅行中他遇到了许多有趣的人。(5) 假日里,那条路上人来车往极为拥挤。
[sound:youdao-e39de262-8d9b8d8a-5ebdba2e-bac61b6f-75799bd4.mp3]

translation:
n. 盘子; 托盘; 浅盘; 满盘

分布：盘(65%)，托盘(35%)


→来自古英语 treg,木板，木盘，来自 Proto-Germanic*trawja,木制容器，来自 deru,树，词 源同 tree,dendrite.tray 背叛
n.盘,碟,托盘The X-rayed prayer preyed a gray tray.照过X光的祈祷者捕获了一个灰色盘子.



noun countable  ADVANCED  ■a flat object, usually with raised edges, used for carrying food and drinks 盘；碟；托盘
•She was carrying a tray of drinks.她端着一托盘饮料。
■mainly UK ■a flat open container with raised edges which you put on your desk for keeping papers in 文件盘
•She put the letter in your in- tray.她把信放在你的收文盘里。

•I don't know where I put that article - it must be in the bottom of my tray.我不知道把那篇文章放在哪里了——肯定是在我的档盘底。
⇒ See also ashtray



n. [机] 托盘； [轻] 文件盒；隔底匣；（无线电的）发射箱
 - plateau, salver
examples: 英 [treɪ] 美 [treɪ]
n.托盘；盘

(1) Put the tray over there.(2) He put the toast on the breakfast tray.(3) I tripped over, dropping the tray I was carrying.(4) Letters were piled high in the tray on his desk.(5) She was carrying a tray of drinks.
(1) 把托盘放到那边去。(2) 他把烤面包片放到早餐托盘里。(3) 我绊了一下，手中的托盘掉在地上了。(4) 他办公桌上的文件盘里有很多信。(5) 她托着一盘饮料。
[sound:youdao-9eece52a-bd8ae331-edb9cd2e-9d71fb15-d9b82101.mp3]

translation:
n. 叛国（罪）; 不忠; 谋反; 背信

分布：叛逆 通敌 背叛 叛国罪(100%)


→来自古法语 traison,背叛，来自拉丁语 traditionem,移交，投降，来自拉丁语 tradere,转移，移 交，词源同 tradition,betray.引申词义叛国罪。
n.谋反,通敌,叛国It's a treason terror of the seasonal oversea seafood is reasonable.认为季节性的海外海鲜的价格是合理的就是背叛.



noun uncountable ■(the crime of) showing no loyalty to your country, especially by helping its enemies or attempting to defeat its government 叛国（罪）
•Guy Fawkes was executed for treason after he took part in a plot to blow up the British Parliament building.盖伊‧福克斯因参与炸毁英国议会大厦的阴谋活动而被以叛国罪处决。




n. [法] 叛国罪；不忠
 - recreancy
examples: 英 ['triːzn] 美 ['triːzn]
n.叛逆 通敌 背叛 叛国罪

(1) He was executed for treason.(2) He was beheaded for high treason.(3) English politician and historian who was falsely accused of treason and banished(1667). While in France he wrote his major work, The History of the Rebellion and Civil Wars in England(1702-1704).(4) They have committed treason against the state.
(1) 他因叛国罪已处死。(2) 他因叛国罪被斩首。(3) 克拉伦登英国政治家和历史学家，被错判叛国罪并流放(1667年)。在法国写出他的重要著作英国叛乱和内战史(1702－1704年)(4) 他们已犯了叛国罪。
[sound:youdao-2a3e8c2c-d4e0172a-22ff54be-11fc2950-01b13dda.mp3]

translation:
n. 金银财宝; 宝藏; 珍宝; 不可多得的人才
vt. 重视; 珍惜; 珍视; 储存

时态：treasured, treasuring, treasures
分布：财富(48%)，珍视(19%)，宝物(18%)，珍藏(15%)


→来自古法语 tresor,宝库，藏宝，来自拉丁语 thesaurus,宝库，来自希腊语 thesauros,仓库，来 自 dhe,做，放置，词源同 do,thesis,thesaurus.引申词义财富，珍宝。
n.财宝,财富;珍品v.珍爱,珍惜I can't endure the leisured man's measures for the treasures in the treasury.我不能容忍那个悠闲男子对金库财宝采取的措施.



US [-ɚ] noun VALUABLE THINGS  珍品   IMPROVER  uncountable ■very valuable things, usually in the form of a store of precious metals, precious stones or money 财宝；珍宝
•Stories about pirates often include a search for buried treasure.海盗故事中经常包括搜寻宝藏。

•When they opened up the tomb they found treasure beyond their wildest dreams.他们挖开坟墓，发现了做梦也想像不到的珍宝。
treasures [plural] ■very valuable things, especially pieces of art 珍宝；（尤指）艺术珍品
•stolen art treasures被盗的艺术珍品

•The museum houses many priceless treasures.这家博物馆收藏了许多价值连城的珍品。

UK ['treʒ.ər] US [-ɚ] noun PERSON  人  countable informal ■someone who is very helpful and valuable to you 很有用的人；很重要的人
•I don't know what I'd have done without Lizzie when I was ill - she was an absolute treasure.我生病时，要不是利齐真，不知道我会怎么样——她真是个不可多得的人。
countable mainly UK old-fashioned informal ■a friendly way of talking to someone, especially a child 宝贝（亲昵称呼，尤指小孩）
•Come on, treasure, let's go and see Granny.赶快，宝贝，我们看奶奶去。

UK ['treʒ.ər] US [-ɚ] verb transitive ■to take great care of something because you love it or consider it very valuable 珍爱；珍惜；珍藏
•I shall always treasure those memories of her.我会一直珍藏对她的回忆。

•This pen that my grandfather gave me is one of my most treasured possessions.我祖父送给我的这支钢笔是我最珍爱的东西之一。




n. 财富，财产；财宝；珍品
 - wealth, estate, money, fortune, property
vt. 珍爱；珍藏
 - cherish, enshrine
examples: 英 ['treʒə(r)] 美 ['treʒər]
n.财富；宝物vt.珍藏；珍视

(1) A nation's treasure is in its scholars.(2) This museum has many art treasures.(3) They went to the cave in quest of hidden treasure.(4) I shall always treasure the memory of our meetings.(5) To treasure what you have is actually the beginning to own everything.
(1) 学者是国家的财富。(2) 这家博物馆收藏了许多艺术珍品。(3) 他们到山洞去寻找宝藏。(4) 我将永远记住我们相聚的情景。(5) 珍惜,是拥有一切的开始。
[sound:youdao-ae9d694e-5637ae6e-d4fa7c42-83d12e6f-7034319d.mp3]

translation:
n. 款待; 招待; 乐事; 乐趣
v. 对待; 治疗; 处理; 款待

时态：treated, treating, treats
分布：治疗(53%)，对待(19%)，处理(10%)，请客(7%)，款待(6%)，视为(2%)，探讨(2%)，宴飨(1%)


→来自古法语 traitier,处理，来自拉丁语 tractare,管理，引导，来自拉丁语 trahere 的反复格动词 形式，词源同 tract,entreat.引申词义对待，治疗，款待等。拼写比较 fact,feat.
v.对待;治疗;论述;款待,请客n.款待,请客In the theater I threatened to treat the treaty with retreat.在剧院里,我威胁要以退却来对待条约.



verb DEAL WITH  对付   ESSENTIAL  transitive usually + adverb or preposition ■to behave towards someone or deal with something in a particular way 对待
•My parents treated us all the same when we were kids.小时候，父母对我们一视同仁。

•He treated his wife very badly.他对妻子很不好。

•It's wrong to treat animals as if they had no feelings.把动物当成没有感情的东西来对待是错误的。

•I treat remarks like that with the contempt that they deserve.那种说法根本不值一提，我对此嗤之以鼻。

[tri:t] verb GIVE MEDICAL CARE  给予治疗   ESSENTIAL  transitive ■to use drugs, exercises, etc. to cure a person of a disease or heal an injury 治疗，医治
•He is being treated for a rare skin disease.他患了一种罕见的皮肤病，正在接受治疗。

•Western medicine tends to treat the symptoms and not the cause.西医往往治标不治本。

[tri:t] verb PAY FOR  为…付款  transitive ■to buy or pay for something for another person 请（客）；款待
•Put your money away - I'm going to treat you (to this).把钱收起来吧——（这次）我请你。

•I'm going to treat my self to (= buy for myself) a new pair of sandals.我要给自己买一双新凉鞋。

[tri:t] verb PUT ON  涂抹  transitive ■to put a special substance on material such as wood, cloth, metal, etc. or put it through a special process, in order to protect it from damage or decay （用特殊物质）涂抹，处理
•The material has been treated with resin to make it waterproof.这种材料涂上了树脂以防水。

[tri:t] verb treat sb like dirt ■to treat someone extremely badly 把（某人）不当人看，把（某人）视为草芥
•For years I allowed him to treat me like dirt.多年来，他一直不把我当人看，我都一直忍着。

[tri:t] verb treat sb like royalty ■to treat someone extremely well 以最高标准招待（某人）
•The staff in the hotel treated us like royalty.饭店工作人员把我们当作贵宾接待。

[tri:t] noun SPECIAL EXPERIENCE  特殊经历  countable ■a special and enjoyable occasion or experience 乐事；享受；特别款待
•We're going to Italy for the weekend - it's my birthday treat.我们要去义大利度周末——为我庆祝生日。

•As a special treat, I'll take you to my favourite tea-shop.我要带你到我最喜欢的茶馆去，这是个特别待遇。

[tri:t] noun PAY FOR  为…付款  my/your etc. treat only singular ■something that I/you etc. buy or pay for for another person 请（客）；款待
•No, you paid for dinner last time - this is my treat.不，上次吃饭是你付钱——这次我请客。

[tri:t] noun a treat UK informal ■very well; with good results 很好；效果不错
•To prevent red wine from staining, put some salt on it - it works a treat.要想不让红葡萄酒留下污渍，在污渍处洒些盐——效果很不错。

•That soup went down a treat (= tasted very good) !那汤很好喝！

•I polished that old desk of grandma's and it came up a treat (= its appearance improved).我把奶奶的那张旧书桌擦了擦，马上就焕然一新。





remedy, heal, cure, treat

这组词都有“治疗、医治”的意思，其区别是：
remedy: 着重用药物对病人进行治疗。
heal: 侧重指治愈伤口、伤痛如灼伤等。
cure: 主要指治愈疾病。
treat: 普通用词，指接受并诊治病人。


vt. 治疗；对待；探讨；视为
 - cure, help
vi. 探讨；请客；协商
 - arrange, confer with
n. 请客；款待
 - entertainment, delectation
examples: 英 [triːt] 美 [triːt]
v.对待；视为；探讨；治疗；处理；请客n.款待；宴飨

(1) We should treat people and animals with humanity.(2) Do not treat a naughty child rough.(3) I decided to treat his remark as a joke.(4) Do not treat me as if I were a child .(5) The documentary treated the question in some detail.(6) This boy is being treated for a heart condition.(7) You ought to treat these matter with candor.(8) This delicate glass must be treated with care.(9) It is my turn to treat us today .(10) A treat has been arranged for the old folk.(11) Her enthusiastic treat made us very happy.
(1) 我们应该仁慈地对待人和动物。(2) 不要粗暴地对待顽皮的孩子。(3) 我决定把他的话当作戏言。(4) 不要把我当作小孩子看待。(5) 这部记录片探讨这个问题有些深度。(6) 这个男孩正在接受心脏病治疗。(7) 你应当公正处理此事。(8) 这精巧的玻璃杯处理时要小心。(9) 今天，该轮到我请客了。(10) 款待老人的事已作了安排。(11) 她的热情款待使我们感到非常高兴。
[sound:youdao-08648b88-aee14e72-7bdc98f0-669fa7df-feea96d1.mp3]

translation:
n. 治疗，疗法; 处理; 待遇，对待

分布：治疗(71%)，处理(22%)，对待(7%)


→treat,对待，处理，ment,名词后缀。
待遇;治疗(treat+ment)[treat=handle,表示"处理"]



noun DEALING WITH  处理   ESSENTIAL  uncountable ■the way you deal with or behave towards someone or something 对待；待遇；处理
•Peter gets special treatment because he knows the boss.彼得认识老板，所以受到特殊待遇。
 IMPROVER  countable or uncountable ■the way something is considered and examined 处理；探讨；论述
•The same subject matter gets a very different treatment by Chris Wilson in his latest novel.在克里斯‧威尔逊最新的小说中，对同样的主题作出了完全不同的处理。

['tri:t.mənt] noun MEDICAL CARE  治疗   ESSENTIAL  countable or uncountable ■the use of drugs, exercises, etc. to cure a person of an illness or injury 治疗，医治
•free dental treatment免费的牙科治疗

•Perhaps it's time to try a new course of treatment.也许该是试试接受新疗程治疗的时候了。

•This disease doesn't generally respond to (= improve as a result of) treatment.这种病通常无法医治。

•There are various treatments for this complaint.这种病有多种治疗方法。




n. [临床] 治疗，疗法；处理；对待
 - therapy, transactions, settlement, disposal, computing
examples: 英 ['triːtmənt] 美 ['triːtmənt]
n.治疗；对待；处理
(1) I tried every treatment the doctor suggested.(2) The treatment arrested the growth of the disease.(3) This is a new product for the treatment of industrial waste.
(1) 我试遍了医生建议的每一种疗法。(2) 治疗抑制了病情的发展。(3) 这是一种处理工业废物的新产品。
[sound:youdao-845a0154-beb2426f-13ed68c6-bfb516d3-f7f617bd.mp3]

translation:
n. 条约; 协议，协商; 谈判

分布：条约(91%)，协定(9%)


→treat,对待，处理，-y,名词后缀。引申词义条约，协定。
条约;约定(treat+y→作出处理的文件→条约)[treat=handle,表示"处理"]
n.条约,协议,协商In the theater I threatened to treat the treaty with retreat.在剧院里,我威胁要以退却来对待条约.
【记】treat（v 对待；处理；谈判），y－做出处理的文件－条约



US [-tˌi] noun countable  IMPROVER  ■a written agreement between two or more countries formally approved and signed by their leaders 条约；协定
•a peace treaty和平条约

•the treaty on European union欧盟的条约

•[+ to infinitive] We've signed/concluded a treaty with neighbouring states to limit emissions of harmful gases.我们和几个邻国签署／缔结了限制有害气体排放的条约。





agreement, contract, treaty, convention, bargain, understanding, accord

这些名词均含“协定，协议，契约，合同”之意。
agreement: 普通用词，含义最确定，泛指个人、团体或国家之间取得一致而达成的任何协议、协定或合同、契约等，可以是口头的，也可以是书面的。
contract: 侧重指双方或多方订立的具有法律效力的正式的书面合同或契约。
treaty: 指国家之间经外交谈判后依照国际法签订的正式条约。
convention: 比treaty更专门化，但不及treaty正式。也可指国家之间就有关事情签订的条约。
bargain: 通常指商业交往中的购销合同。
understanding: 指不具约束力的非正式的协议。
accord: 多指国际间的非正式协议。


n. [法] 条约，协议；谈判
 - agreement, protocol, negotiation, understanding, accord
examples: 英 ['triːti] 美 ['triːti]
n.条约；协定

(1) The treaty gave (a) fresh impetus to trade.(2) There is a contentious clause in the treaty.(3) The Government has signed a treaty with Moscow.(4) The house was sold by private treaty.(5) We are feeling our way towards a treaty.
(1) 这条约使双方的贸易又推进了一步。(2) 这条约中有一条有争议的条款。(3) 政府已与莫斯科签了一项条约。(4) 这所房子以私人协议的方式售出。(5) 我们正试图达到协定。

translation:
vi. 发抖; 焦虑; 颤动; 轻轻摇晃
n. 震颤，发抖; 颤动，震动; 摇晃; 战栗
vt. 使挥动; 用颤抖的声音说出; 颤动，震动; 焦虑，担忧

时态：trembled, trembling, trembles
分布：颤抖(51%)，发抖(37%)，震颤(7%)，忧虑(4%)，战悚(1%)


→来自古法语 trembler,颤抖，恐惧，来自拉丁语 tremere,颤抖，摇摆，来自 trem,颤抖，来 自 ter,转，摇，扭曲，词源同 turn,torture.插入字母 b,比较 number,numerate.
发抖;摇动(trem+dle)[trem=quiver,表示"颤抖"]
n.战栗,颤抖v.发抖,颤抖;摇动;焦虑The trembles of the umbrella assembly lines have resemblances.这些雨伞装配线的抖动有相似之处.
【记】源于：tremulous（adj 颤抖的）；tremor（n /v 震动）



verb intransitive  ADVANCED  ■to shake slightly, usually because you are cold, frightened, or very emotional （通常因寒冷、害怕或情绪激动）颤抖，发抖
•When he came out of the water, he was trembling with cold.他从水里出来时，冷得直打哆嗦。

•Her bottom lip trembled and tears welled up in her eyes.她的下嘴唇颤抖，泪水也涌上眼眶。

•His voice started to tremble and I thought he was going to cry.他的声音开始颤抖，我以为他要哭了。

['trem.bl] verb intransitive tremble to think ■If you say that you tremble to think about a possible future event, you are worried or frightened about it 担心，害怕
•I tremble to think what will happen when he finds out.我真担心他发现后会怎么样。

['trem.bl] noun countable or uncountable ■when something or someone trembles 颤抖；发抖
•There was a slight tremble in her voice as she recalled her husband.她回忆丈夫时声音微微发颤。





tremble, shudder, quiver, shake, vibrate, shiver

这组词都有“震动，颤抖”的意思，其区别是：
tremble: 指由于寒冷、虚弱、愤怒或恐惧等而发抖、战栗。
shudder: 着重指由于恐惧、震惊等而引起的全身突然而强烈地战栗。
quiver: 多用于指事物。指物体像乐器的弦一般地轻微而急速地颤动。
shake: 最普通用词，含义广。指人或物不自主地颤动、摇摆，常侧重剧烈和无规律。
vibrate: 指急速地连续震动，也指钟摆等的来回摆动。
shiver: 指因寒冷或情绪突变而出现的短时间的轻微和快速的颤抖。


vi. 发抖；战栗；焦虑；摇晃
 - roll, rock
n. 颤抖；战栗；摇晃
 - roll, frisson
examples: 英 ['trembl] 美 ['trembl]
n.战悚；颤抖v.发抖；忧虑；震颤

(1) His remarks struck a tremble into her heart.(2) The dog was all of a tremble with cold.(3) He was trembling with rage.(4) After the severest reprimand, he did not tremble .(5) I tremble to think what's going to happen.(6) The whole house trembled when the train went by.
(1) 他的话令她感到不寒而栗。(2) 这条狗冻得全身发抖。(3) 他气得发抖。(4) 即使受到最严厉的申斥，他也不发抖。(5) 我一想到即将发生的事就担心。(6) 火车经过时，整座房子都在震颤。
[sound:youdao-6934c929-8f820ffd-9543aa32-bbb34cf9-d24c42ec.mp3]

translation:
adj. 极大的，巨大的; 可怕的，惊人的; 极好的

分布：巨大的(83%)，惊人的(17%)


→来自拉丁语 tremere,颤抖，恐惧，词源同 tremble.-end,动名词格，-ous,形容词后缀。引申词 义巨大的，极大的。
惊人的,可怕的(trem+end+ous→[让人]颤抖的→可怕的)[trem=quiver,表示"颤抖"]
a.巨大的,极大的The tenderer surrendered her tremendously slender tender fingers.投标者交出了她异常纤细娇嫩的手指.



adjective  IMPROVER  ■very great in amount or level, or extremely good 巨大的；极好的
•They were making the most tremendous amount of noise last night.昨晚他们弄出的噪声震天响。

•She's been a tremendous (= very great) help to me over the last few months.过去几个月里，她给我的帮助极大。

•You won? That's tremendous!你赢了？太棒了！





tremendous, colossal, huge, gigantic, massive, vast, enormous, immense, giant

这组词都有“巨大的，庞大的”的意思，其区别是：
tremendous: 指某物很大，大得惊人；也可用作引申意义。
colossal: 侧重尺寸、规模和体积的无比巨大。
huge: 含义广，强调体积或容积的庞大。也可用于引申意义。
gigantic: 指面积或体积的巨大，但多用于引申意义。
massive: 指大的体积、数量和重量，侧重庞大而笨重。
vast: 多指空间、面积、范围的巨大，不涉及重量。
enormous: 指体积、数量或程度远远超过一般标准。
immense: 正式用词，侧重空间的广阔，也指面积或分量的巨大。
giant: 非正式用词，多为褒义。指如巨人般的庞大体积。


adj. 极大的，巨大的；惊人的
 - huge, enormous, massive, macro, vast
examples: 英 [trə'mendəs] 美 [trə'mendəs]
adj.巨大的；惊人的

(1) He has a tremendous hold over his younger brother.(2) She does her work with tremendous vigour.(3) The discovery caused a tremendous commotion in the scientific world.(4) We got a tremendous surprise when she arrived.(5) He's a tremendous talker.
(1) 他对他弟弟很有影响。(2) 她工作起来干劲十足。(3) 那项发现在科学界引起极大的震动。(4) 她的到来使我们大吃一惊。(5) 他是一个非常健谈的人。
[sound:youdao-602fbe86-1adca0cf-e334dac7-703d4a98-f0596f3c.mp3]

translation:
n. 走向; 趋向; 时尚，时髦
vi. 倾向; 趋势

时态：trended, trending, trends
分布：趋势(91%)，倾向(7%)，转向(1%)，方位(1%)


→来自古英语 trendan,滚动，转动，来自 Proto-Germanic*trandijana,旋转，词源同 trundle,轮子， 滚轮。该词原指河流或海湾的拐弯，后引申词义潮流，趋势，动向等。
n.倾向,趋势vi.伸向,倾向I spend money on expensive things endlessly; so the expenditure trends up.我无休止地花钱买昂贵的东西,所以开支趋向上升.
【记】源于：tend（v 趋向；照管）



noun countable  ESSENTIAL  ■a general development or change in a situation or in the way that people are behaving 趋势，趋向；倾向，动向
•Surveys show a trend away from home-ownership and towards rented accommodation.调查显示，出现了一种从私人拥有住房转向租赁住房的趋势。

•There's been a downward/upward trend in sales in the last few years.过去几年，销售额一直呈下降／上升趋势。
 ADVANCED  ■a new development in clothing, make-up, etc. 时尚；新款式
•Whatever the latest fashion trend, you can be sure Nicki will be wearing it.不管是甚么样的流行款式，尼基肯定会穿。

•The trend at the moment is towards a more natural and less made-up look.时下的潮流是多一分自然，少一些妆容。





trend, tendency, current

这组词都有“趋势，倾向”的意思，其区别是：
trend: 指事物发展总的方向、倾向或趋势。
tendency: 指固有或习得的倾向性，强调没有外来的影响或干扰。
current: 指向某一方面发展或在确趋向中行动。



course, trend, stage

course: 过程
trend: 趋势
stage: （发展）阶段，舞台


n. [统计] 趋势，倾向； [地质] 走向
 - tendency, tide, direction, liability, set
vi. 趋向，伸向
 - verge on, tend towards
examples: 英 [trend] 美 [trend]
n.趋势；倾向；方位vi.倾向；转向

(1) The trend of prices is still upward.(2) The youth like to follow the latest trends in fashion.(3) This quartet represents a major new trend in modern music.(4) The event changed the trend of public opinion.(5) The mountains have a western trend.(6) The prices of houses are trending upwards.(7) The trend towards product customization has forced many apparel manufacturers to shift from mass production to more flexible, high-volume production.(8) Actually, the trend of Anti-Humanistic thought is also a kind of humanism which is deeply influenced by the shift of western philosophy.
(1) 物价仍有上涨趋势。(2) 年轻人喜好追求最新的流行款式。(3) 这首四重奏的曲子反映了现代音乐中一种主要的新趋向。(4) 这件事改变了舆论的趋向。(5) 群山向西延伸。(6) 房价趋于上涨。(7) 产品的定制化趋势迫使许多服装制造厂家不得不由批量生产转向更灵活的高产量生产。(8) 反人道主义思潮受到西方哲学转向的深刻影响，反人道主义思潮实际上也是一种人道主义。
[sound:youdao-d93f9545-d32ed186-569c3de3-d45bbc24-5afb3594.mp3]

translation:
n. 试验; [法]审讯，审判; 磨难，困难; [体]选拔赛
adj. 试验的; [法]审讯的

分布：试验(45%)，审讯(20%)，试用(18%)，尝试(10%)，测试(3%)，惹麻烦的人(2%)，预赛或选拔赛(1%)，讨厌的事(1%)


→来自 try,甄选，选出，尝试，审理，-al,名词后缀。引申诸相关词义。
n.讯问,审讯;试验;试用;尝试Life is full of trials.人生充满着磨难.



noun LEGAL PROCESS  法律程式   ESSENTIAL  countable or uncountable ■the hearing of statements and showing of objects, etc. in a court of law to judge whether a person is guilty of a crime or to decide a case or a legal matter 审判，审理
•trial proceedings审判程式

•Trial by jury is a fundamental right.由陪审团审判是一项基本权利。

•It was a very complicated trial that went on for months.该审判非常复杂，历时数月。

•She's going on/standing trial for fraud.她因诈骗而将受审。
⇒ See also try
[traɪəl] noun TEST  试验   IMPROVER  countable or uncountable ■a test, usually over a limited period of time, to discover how effective or suitable something or someone is 试验；试用
•They're doing clinical trials on a new drug.他们正在对一种新药进行临床试验。

•They've employed her for a six-month trial (period).他们录用了她，试用期为六个月。

•mainly UK You can buy any of their garden equipment on trial] US usuallyon a  trial  basis , and if you don't like it you can give it back.你买他们的任何园艺设备都可以试用，如果不喜欢可以退货。

[traɪəl] noun PROBLEM  问题  countable ■a person or thing that is annoying and causes a lot of problems 惹麻烦的人；令人伤脑筋的事物；考验
•She was a real trial to her parents when she was younger.她年轻时真令父母头痛。

•The book is all about the trials of growing up.这本书讲的全是成长过程中经历的种种烦恼。

[traɪəl] noun EXAMINATION  考试  countable Australian ■a mock  (= examination taken at school for practice before a real examination) 预试（在学校中进行的一种模拟考试，或在实际考试之前进行的训练）
•In Australian schools, trials take place in July.在澳大利亚的学校中，预试通常在七月举行。

[traɪəl] noun trials and tribulations literary or humorous ■troubles and events that cause suffering 艰辛；麻烦；苦难
•the trials and tribulations of marriage婚姻中的种种考验与磨炼

[traɪəl] verb transitive (-ll- or -l-)■to test something in a formal way to discover how effective or suitable it is 试验；试用
•We're trialing the new drug in several hospitals.我们正在几家医院试用这种新药。





test, experiment, trial, try

这组词都有“试验”的意思，其区别是：
test: 普通用词，含义广，指用科学方法对某物质进行测试以估价其性质或效能等。
experiment: 多指用科学方法在实验室内进行较系统的操作实验以验证、解释或说明某一理论、定理或某一观点等。
trial: 指为观察、研究某事物以区别其真伪、优劣或效果等而进行较长时间的试验或试用过程。
try: 普通用词，多用于口语或非正式场合，指试一试。


n. [试验] 试验；审讯；努力；磨炼
 - effort, hearing, pain, proof, experiment
adj. [试验] 试验的；审讯的
 - testing
examples: [串记] trial：试验，试验的 / trail ：追踪，小径，踪迹 / tail：尾巴，尾随
英 ['traɪəl] 美 ['traɪəl]
n.审讯；试验；试用；尝试；预赛或选拔赛；讨厌的事；惹麻烦的人v.测试

(1) He went through hell during the trial.(2) The flier is flying a new-type jet plane on trial.(3) She agreed to employ me for a trial period.(4) Trial and error is the source of our knowledge.(5) They succeeded in the experiment on the fifteenth trial.(6) His blindness is a great trial to him.(7) The child was a trial to his parents.
(1) 审讯期间他吃尽了苦头。(2) 飞行员正在驾驶一架新式喷气机作试验飞行。(3) 她同意试用我一段时间。(4) 尝试和失败同是学识之源。(5) 他们在第十五次尝试时获得了成功。(6) 眼睛瞎对他来说是非常麻烦的事。(7) 那孩子真让他父母烦得够呛。

n.三角(形)The language angel hanged up the gang and banged them at the angle of the triangle.语文天使将那伙人吊起朝三角形的角上猛撞.

translation:
n. 部落，部族; [生]族; 一帮，一伙; 大群

分布：部落(59%)，族(40%)，一伙人(1%)


→来自拉丁语 tribus,部落，宗族，地区，特指古罗马城邦三个宗族集团，即现在为人们熟知的 Latins,Sabines,Etruscans.可能来自 tri-,三，-be,存在，词源同 be,phylum.或来自 treb,居住， 聚居，词源同 thorp,troop.
n.种族,部落;(植物,动物)族,类Those innocent adolescents ascending the hill are the tribe's descendants of decent descent.这些爬山的天真青少年是这个部落具有正派血统的后代.



noun countable [+ sing/pl verb]  IMPROVER  ■a group of people, often of related families, who live together, sharing the same language, culture and history, especially those who do not live in towns or cities 部落；部族
•a tribe of Amazonian Indians亚马孙河流域印第安人的一个部落

•the Masai tribe马萨伊人部落
■informal ■a large family or other group that someone belongs to 家族；集团
•We've invited Carol's sisters and brothers and their spouses and children - the whole Cassidy tribe.我们邀请了卡罗尔的兄弟姐妹及其配偶、子女——整个凯西迪家族。




n. 部落； [生物] 族；宗族；一伙
 - nationality, clan
examples: 英 [traɪb] 美 [traɪb]
n.部落；族；一伙人

(1) A council of elders governs the tribe.(2) Our tribe is under a curse.(3) I have heard the cannibal tribe in stories.(4) That Indian man is a member of the neighbouring tribe.(5) The Uighur,originally called Ouigour,sprang from the ancient tribe Teli.(6) A tribe of artists live in Greenwich Village.
(1) 有个叫长老会的组织治理这个部落。(2) 我们的部落正受诅咒。(3) 我在故事里听说过食人部落。(4) 那个印第安人是临近部落的成员。(5) 回鹘，原称回纥，是铁勒(中国古族名)诸部之一。(6) 在格林尼治村住着许多艺术家。

translation:
n. 戏法，把戏; 计谋，诀窍; 骗局; 恶作剧
vt. 哄骗，欺骗; 打扮
adj. 弄虚作假的; 有诀窍的; 欺诈的

时态：tricked, tricking, tricks
分布：把戏(28%)，诀窍(18%)，欺骗(17%)，诡计(14%)，花招(14%)，戏弄(5%)，有阴谋的(2%)，有诡计的(2%)


→来自古法语 trichier,欺骗，诡计，来自拉丁语 tricari,逃避，回避，来自 tricae,琐碎，胡扯，混 乱，可能来自 ter,转，卷入，词源同 turn,intricate,extricate.引申词义花招，把戏等。
n.诡计,骗局;恶作剧;窍门vt.欺骗,哄骗His wicked trick is to get the kids to kick bricks and lick the cricket ticket.他的缺德恶作剧是让孩子们踢砖和舔板球门票.



noun countable ACT OF DECEIVING  欺骗行为   IMPROVER  ■an action which is intended to deceive, either as a way of cheating someone, or as a joke or form of entertainment 骗局；诡计；恶作剧
•She played  a really nasty trick  on me - she put syrup in my shampoo bottle!她对我做了一个很讨厌的恶作剧——把糖浆放进我装洗发精的瓶子里。

•My niece was showing me all the tricks that she's learned to do with her new magic set.我侄女给我表演了她学过的用她那套新魔术道具所能变出的所有戏法。

•It's a bit of trick photography - she's meant to look like she's walking on water.这有点特技摄影的样子——她想要看上去像在水上行走一般。
be a trick of the light ■to be a visual effect caused by the light, making something appear different 是光造成的错觉
•For a moment I thought you had a patch of grey hairs, but it's just a trick of the light.一时间我以为你长了一撮白发，看来只是光线造成的错觉而已。

[trɪk] noun countable METHOD  方法   ADVANCED  ■an effective or quick way of doing something 诀窍，秘诀；技巧
•What's the trick of getting this chair to fold up?把这张椅子折叠起来有甚么诀窍？

•On page 21, twenty tricks to speed up your beauty routine.第21页介绍了20种日常快速化妆技巧。

[trɪk] noun countable do the trick informal ■If something does the trick, it has the necessary or wanted effect 奏效，起作用
•This sauce needs a bit of flavour - I know, some lemon juice should/ought to do the trick.这种调味汁需要加点味——我知道了，加点柠檬汁就可以了。

[trɪk] noun countable every trick in the book ■every possible way 所有可能的办法；浑身解数
•I've tried every trick in the book to seduce him and still no luck!我想尽一切办法去引诱他，可还是一点机会都没有！

[trɪk] noun countable How's tricks? informal ■How are you? 近来如何？你好吗？
•"Hi, how's tricks?" "Oh, fine, how are you doing?"“嘿，你好吗?” “哦，很好，你呢?”

[trɪk] noun countable trick of the trade ■a clever method used by people who are experienced in a particular type of work or activity （某一行业或活动的）绝招，绝活，门道
•Newspapers often improve photographs before they print them - it's one of the tricks of the trade.报纸在刊发照片前，往往要对照片进行修饰——这是一种行业手法。

[trɪk] verb transitive ■to deceive someone, often as a part of a plan 欺骗，诱骗，哄骗
•Dean tricked the old lady into giving him eight hundred pounds, claiming that he would invest it for her.迪安骗了这个老妇人800英镑，说是帮她投资。

[trɪk] adjective [before noun] DECEIVING  欺骗  ■used to deceive someone, either as a joke or form of entertainment or so that they make a mistake 捉弄，戏弄；恶作剧（用于欺骗某人，或作为一个玩笑或作为一种娱乐形式，使之犯错误）
•a trick question一个智力问题

[trɪk] adjective [before noun] WEAK  软弱的  US  describes a part of the body, especially a joint (= place where two bones are connected) , that sometimes feels weak suddenly and unexpectedly （尤指关节）有时突然发软的
•I've got a trick ankle which gives me problems if I do much running.我的脚关节有时会突然发软，跑多了会给我带来不少麻烦。





deceive, cheat, trick, fool

这组词都有“欺骗”的意思，其区别是：
deceive: 最普通用词，指用虚假外表使人信以为真，或蓄意歪曲事实，或造成错误印象使人上当受骗。
cheat: 普通用词，指用蒙蔽他人的手段取得所需之物，尤多指在赢利的买卖中欺骗人。
trick: 指用阴谋诡计等骗得信任或得到所需之物。
fool: 指把别人当傻瓜，愚弄欺骗别人。


n. 诡计；恶作剧；窍门；花招；骗局；欺诈
 - scheme, fraud
vt. 欺骗；哄骗；装饰；打扮
 - sell, paint, hang, dress oneself, fox
vi. 哄骗；戏弄
 - kid, fool with
adj. [电影] 特技的；欺诈的；有决窍的
 - deceptive, acrobatic
examples: 英 [trɪk] 美 [trɪk]
n.诡计；花招；把戏；诀窍vt.欺骗；戏弄adj.有诡计的；有阴谋的

(1) Her tears were just a trick to deceive others.(2) You can't fool me with that old trick!(3) If you watch carefully,you'll see how the trick is done.(4) The trick is to hold your breath while you aim.(5) Her partner tried to trick her out of her share.(6) There are rumors about that you are trying to trick me.(7) This man is quite trick and undependable.
(1) 她的眼泪只是欺骗别人的诡计。(2) 你玩弄那种老花招骗不了我!(3) 如果你仔细观看,你就会发现那个把戏是怎么耍的。(4) 窍门就在于瞄准时须屏住呼吸。(5) 她的合伙人企图骗走她的股份。(6) 有传言说你在耍我。(7) 这个人滑头滑脑，很不可靠。
[sound:youdao-82082d34-49cb67b8-ac4b8ab1-501b5b08-5aaef148.mp3]

vi. 轻视，藐视; 嘲弄; 随意摆弄，玩弄
vt. 浪费（时间或金钱）; 虚度

时态：trifled, trifling, trifles
分布：琐事(39%)，浪费(27%)，玩弄(23%)，少量(11%)

rifle 步枪;抢劫
→来自古法语 trufle,嘲笑，嘲弄，小词形式于 truffe,欺骗。现词义可能来自不同词或受 trivial 影响。
n.少量;小事,琐事v.玩弄;嬉耍;忽视The merest trifle puts her out.一点小事就会使她心急.



noun SWEET DISH  甜点  countable or uncountable ■a sweet cold dish consisting of a layer of fruit and sponge (= cake) , a layer of  custard (= thick sweet yellow sauce) and a top layer of cream 鲜奶油松糕，果酱松糕（一种甜点，包括一层水果海绵蛋糕、一层蛋奶酱和一层鲜奶油）
•a sherry trifle雪利酒浸果酱松糕

['traɪ.fl] noun UNIMPORTANT THING  不重要的东西  countable formal ■a matter or object of little value or importance 琐事；零碎事
•I brought a few trifles back from India - bits of jewellery and material mainly.我从印度带回来几样小玩意——主要是些首饰和布料。
a trifle ■slightly 稍微，略微
•I'm a trifle confused about the arrangements for tonight.我对今晚的安排有点不太明白。

['traɪ.fl] verb   Phrasal Verbs   trifle with sb/sth formal or old-fashioned ■to treat someone or something carelessly or without respect 戏弄；怠慢；小看
•He trifled with her affections (= feelings).他玩弄她的感情。
•As you know, Caroline O'Neill is not a woman to be trifled with.你也知道，卡罗琳‧奥尼尔这个女人可怠慢不得。



n. 琐事；蛋糕；少量
 - cake, bit
vi. 开玩笑；闲混；嘲弄
 - fool, kid around
vt. 浪费；虚度
 - lose, spend, moon, fool away
examples: 英 ['traɪfl] 美 ['traɪfl]
n.琐事；少量v.浪费；玩弄

(1) I do not want to make a fuss over such a trifle.(2) They had an altercation about a trifle.(3) He told her not to pester him with trifles.(4) I have only a trifle of wine left.(5) I'll have just a trifle of the dessert.(6) Don't trifle away your time on curio hunting.(7) Don't trifle with serious matter.(8) Never trifle with other's affections.(9) It's dangerous to trifle with such a fierce animal.
(1) 我不想为这种小事大惊小怪。(2) 他们为一点小事争吵起来。(3) 他告诉她别拿些琐事来烦他。(4) 我只剩下一点点酒了。(5) 我只要吃少量的甜点心。(6) 别把时间都浪费在搜集古玩上面。(7) 对大事不可儿戏。(8) 不要玩弄别人的感情。(9) 逗弄如此凶残的动物是很危险的。

translation:
vt. 修剪; 整理; 装饰
adj. 整齐的，整洁的; 修长的; 苗条的
n. 整齐; 修剪; 健康状态; 装束
vi. 削减

时态：trimmed, trimming, trims
分布：修剪(35%)，装饰(32%)，削减(21%)，整齐(7%)，整洁的(3%)，匀称的(1%)，调整帆以适应风向(1%)


→来自古英语 trymian,使整齐，安排，加强，来自 Proto-Germanic*trum,坚固的，固定的，deru, 稳定的，稳固的，词源同 tree,true.引申词义修剪树枝，修整，装饰等。
a.整齐的,整洁的v./n.整理,修整,装饰With a dim triumph, she trims the swimming-suit rim at the swimming-pool brim.她带着暗淡的喜悦在泳池边整理泳装的边缘.



verb transitive (-mm-)CUT  剪  ■to make something tidier or more level by cutting a small amount off it 修剪，修整
•to trim the hedge修剪树篱

•My hair needs trimming.我的头发需要剪一剪。

•Trim off the leafy ends of the vegetable before cooking.烹饪之前，去掉菜多叶的一端。

[trɪm] verb transitive (-mm-)REDUCE  减少  ■to reduce the amount or size of something 消减，减少
•They're trying to trim their costs, so staff who leave are not being replaced.他们正试图降低成本，所以没有安排填补离职员工的空缺。

[trɪm] adjective (trimmer, trimmest)THIN  瘦的  approving■thin in an attractive and healthy way 苗条的
•You're looking very trim - have you lost weight?你看起来很苗条——你减肥了吗？

[trɪm] adjective (trimmer, trimmest)TIDY  整齐的  ■tidy and well-ordered 整齐的
•trim lawns and neat flower beds平整的草坪和整洁的花坛

[trɪm] noun CUT  剪  only singular ■when you make something, especially someone's hair, tidier or more level by cutting a small amount off it 修剪，修整
•I asked the hairdresser for a trim.我请理发师给我修剪一下头发。

•Just give the ends a trim, please.请把梢修一修就行。

[trɪm] noun MATERIAL  材料  countable or uncountable ■trimming 
[trɪm] noun PREPARED  准备好的  in trim informal ■physically prepared and ready, or in good condition 身体状况好；状态好
•Are you in trim for the run on Sunday?星期天的赛跑你准备好了吗？





orderly, tidy, neat, trim

这组词都有“整齐的，整洁的”的意思，其区别是：
orderly: 语义比上述几个词强，最常用。指把复杂细微的东西按其内在联系安排整齐，侧重井井有条。
tidy: 侧重整齐，井然有序。
neat: 指人或物外表既清洁又整齐。
trim: 着重因线条清晰、比例匀称而使外观呈现出紧凑和精确、美观。


vt. 修剪；整理；装点
 - shear, arrange, crop
vi. 削减
 - cut to the bone, cut down to
n. 修剪；整齐；情形
 - status, shear, regularity
adj. 整齐的
 - ordered, regular, straight, soigne
examples: 英 [trɪm] 美 [trɪm]
v.修剪；削减；装饰；调整帆以适应风向adj.整洁的；匀称的n.修剪；整齐；装饰

(1) I'll have my hair trimmed tomorrow.(2) We have to trim our cost if we want to increase our profit.(3) They trim their Christmas trees with strings of colored lights.(4) The crew is in trim for the boat-race.(5) The new house has a trim appearance.(6) I'd just like a trim and don't make it too short.(7) Everything in his tool chest was in good trim.(8) Install door waterdam and trim panel.(9) I bought a dress with golden lace trim.
